Title: Senior Mobile Developer
Description:
About the job Senior Mobile Developer

The Senior Mobile Developer will spearhead the development and management of our mobile applications across iOS and Android platforms. This role is responsible for ensuring adherence to industry coding practices, performing 100% of code reviews, and driving application performance and stability. In addition, the Mobile Developer Team Lead will manage agile processes and mentor their team to ensure high-quality and timely delivery in a hybrid work setting (located in Thailand).

Key Responsibilities:
• Code Quality and Review
Lead comprehensive code reviews for both iOS (Swift with SwiftUI) and Android (Kotlin with a preference for Jetpack Compose).
• Mobile Application Performance Optimization
Ensure both iOS and Android applications meet defined performance benchmarks, including responsiveness, stability, and load times.
• Team Leadership and Mentorship
Mentor and guide the mobile development team in technical practices and agile methodologies, fostering continuous improvement and skill enhancement.
• Agile Project Management
Lead agile ceremonies (sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily stand-ups) in close collaboration with the Director of Software Development. Ensure timely sprint completions, effective issue resolution, and adherence to agile processes.
• Continuous Improvement and Innovation
Identify and integrate emerging mobile technologies and best practices to enhance app functionality and development efficiency.

Job Qualifications:

Education
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Experience
• Minimum of 9 years in mobile application development with proven expertise in both iOS and Android platforms.
• Demonstrated leadership in managing mobile development teams within agile environments.
• Experience working in a hybrid setup; candidates must be located in Thailand.

Training/License/Certification
• Relevant certifications in mobile development or agile methodologies are advantageous.

Skills and Essential Traits
• Leadership: Proven ability to guide, mentor, and inspire cross-functional mobile development teams.
• Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of iOS development using Swift and SwiftUI, as well as Android development using Kotlin (Jetpack Compose is required).
• Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for effective collaboration with both technical teams and key stakeholders.
• Problem Solving: Strong analytical skills with the capability to troubleshoot and resolve mobile application issues efficiently.
• Agile Proficiency: In-depth understanding of Scrum and agile methodologies to drive efficient project management.
• Innovation: Proactive in adopting emerging mobile technologies and best practices to enhance development processes and app performance.
• Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment while maintaining high-quality standards.

Work Conditions
• Hybrid work arrangement: Applicants must be Thai nationals and based in Thailand.

Title: Mobile Engineer/Developer

Stay updated on design trends and industry dynamics, emerging technologies, and best practices in CX/UX design to bring fresh ideas and innovative approaches to the team. Demonstrable proficiency in user journey mapping techniques, design thinking methodologies, and facilitating ideation workshops. Solid understanding of user-centered service design principles and best practices. Experience with user research, usability testing, and data-driven design decision making. Visual design competency desirable with deep understanding of user experience. Proficient with design tools such as Figma, Figjam, Miro, Adobe XD, or similar software. Ability to effectively communicate and articulate design concepts and decisions. Strong presentation skills (both verbally and written); ability to articulate complex research in a clear and simple manner to a variety of audiences. Solutions-oriented team player with track record in executing across a diverse range of priorities. Intellectual curiosity, creative thinker; desire to constantly learn and continuously improve. Excellent ability to establish, develop, and maintain trust-based relationships with key stakeholders and peers.0 Work Location & Schedule: Amenable to work in Ayala North Exchange Makati and on a Hybrid work set-up (3x onsite per week) Amenable to work on a permanent nightshift schedule (4:00 PM to 1:00 AM, PHT) #LI-MCG95 #ASSOCIATE What You Can Expect from Us At ISS STOXX, our people are our driving force. We are committed to building a culture that values diverse skills, perspectives, and experiences. We hire the best talent in our industry and empower them with the resources, support, and opportunities to grow—professionally and personally. Together, we foster an environment that fuels creativity, drives innovation, and shapes our future success. Let’s empower, collaborate, and inspire. Let’s be #BrilliantTogether. About ISS STOXX ISS STOXX GmbH is a leading provider of research and technology solutions for the financial market. Established in 1985, we offer top-notch benchmark and custom indices globally, helping clients identify investment opportunities and manage portfolio risks. Our services cover corporate governance, sustainability, cyber risk, and fund intelligence. Majority-owned by Deutsche Börse Group, ISS STOXX has over 3,400 professionals in 33 locations worldwide, serving around 6,400 clients, including institutional investors and companies focused on ESG, cyber, and governance risk. Clients trust our expertise to make informed decisions for their stakeholders' benefit. ISS Market Intelligence (ISS MI) is a leading provider of data, insights, and market engagement solutions to the global financial services industry. ISS MI empowers asset and wealth management firms, insurance companies, distributors, service providers, and technology firms to assess their target markets, identify and analyze the best opportunities within those markets, and execute on comprehensive go-to-market initiatives to grow their business. Clients benefit from our increasingly connected global platform that leverages a combination of proprietary data, powerful analytics, timely and relevant insights, in-depth research, as well as an extensive suite of industry-leading media brands that deliver unmatched market connectivity through news and editorial content, events, training, ratings, and awards. Visit our website: https://www.issgovernance.com View additional open roles: https://www.issgovernance.com/join-the-iss-team/ Institutional Shareholder Services (“ISS”) is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. All activities including, but not limited to, recruiting and hiring, recruitment advertising, promotions, performance appraisals, training, job assignments, compensation, demotions, transfers, terminations (including layoffs), benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment, are and will be administered on a non-discriminatory basis, consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local requirements. Let's empower, collaborate, and inspire one another. Let's be #BrilliantTogether! ISS STOXX GmbH, through its group companies, is a leading provider of comprehensive and data-centric research and technology solutions that help capital market participants identify investment opportunities, detect qualitative and quantitative portfolio company risks, and meet evolving regulatory requirements. With roots dating back to 1985, we today deliver world-class benchmark and custom indices across asset classes and geographies and serve as a premier source of independent corporate governance, sustainability, cyber risk, and fund intelligence research, data, and related offerings. Our products and services give clients the scale and leverage they need to grow their business more effectively and efficiently. ISS STOXX, which is majority owned by Deutsche Börse Group, is comprised of more than 3,400 professionals operating across 33 global locations in 19 countries. Its approximately 6,400 clients include many of the world’s leading institutional investors who turn to ISS STOXX for its objective and varied offerings, as well as companies focused on ESG, cyber, and governance risk mitigation as a shareholder value enhancing measure. Title: UI/UX Designer
Description:
White Cloak is looking for a UI/UX Designer (Project-based) to be part of our amazing team providing top-tier software development services to build world-class software solutions that makes peoples lives easier and fun to live with. Youll work with a cross-functional team, collaborate with clients, implement industry standards and practices, and continuously grow as a software engineer. Join us in leading people at the frontier of technology.

Responsibilities
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches, and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors, and images

Skills & Qualifications
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision)
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software (e.g. Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, and Photoshop)
• Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills

Note:
• 6-month employment contract
• No other benefits will be given apart from basic pay + allowance and government mandated benefits
• Please include your portfolio (link) along with your most updated CV

Company background
White Cloak is a software development company that creates custom digital solutions to empower businesses. Established in 2014, White Cloak has been an innovation partner of major corporations, leveraging technology to take its clients business to the next level. Get a chance to work with the vibrant innovative team behind groundbreaking apps such as Unionbank Online and Ayala Malls Zing.

Learn more about us at whitecloak.com

Title: UI/UX Designer

• Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Sr. UI UX Designer
Description:
As a
Sr.
UX UI Designer, you deliver exceptional design for websites, web apps, and mobile apps. You balance user needs with business requirements to create leading digital products and services. You are experienced in best practices while understanding when you can break the mold to ideate on groundbreaking experiences. You work with the team to create experience concepts, journey maps, user stories, product roadmaps, and/or an initial set of product features, helping to pave the way for your team. You have a great eye for design and can create visually stunning designs that are modern, engaging, and, most of all, designed for the target audience.

What You Do:
• Collaborate with your creative leads and project managers across different timezones.
• Work on various digital projects simultaneously, including websites, apps, interactive media, and other user-centric products.
• Execute projects with high attention to detail, on time and budget.
• Participate in defining and implementing user-centered design strategies that align with project goals, brand guidelines, and customer expectations, ensuring the creation of intuitive, cohesive, and visually appealing user interfaces.
• Support the entire UX/UI design process, from concept and wireframing to prototyping and final design, focusing on functionality and aesthetics.
• Contribute to the consistency, quality, and innovation within UX/UI design across projects, adhering to best practices and guidelines.
• Assist in maintaining a consistent user experience across all digital deliverables, collaborating with other designers and developers.
• Stay current with the latest UX/UI trends, tools, technologies, and best practices, continuously enhancing personal and team expertise.

What You Need to Succeed:
• BA or equivalent in Design, UX/UI, Human-Computer Interaction, or related fields.
• 2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Designer in a reputable creative agency, technology company, or in-house design team.
• Strong portfolio showcasing a variety of user-centric design projects, such as website design, app design, interactive media, etc.
• Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, InVision, and basic understanding of coding languages like HTML, CSS.
• Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, interaction design, usability testing, user research methods, and accessibility standards.
• Good grasp of design fundamentals, including typography, color theory, grid systems, and attention to detail.
• Ability to follow creative direction and translate it into compelling and effective user experiences.
• Mindful of your time, budget and schedule, you are flexible and willing to put in the time and dedication needed to make each project you and your team work on a success.
• Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
• A team-focused mindset, with experience working collaboratively with UX/UI Leads, Art Directors, and creative teams.

What’s In Store For You:
• Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a generous salary that recognizes your skills and contributions
• Flexibility at its Finest: Embrace the freedom of a 100% remote work environment, giving you the autonomy to work where you're most productive
• Rewards Galore: Benefit from enticing company incentives and rewards that celebrate your achievements
• Profit-share: As a valued team member, you'll have the opportunity to partake in our profit-sharing plan
• Health and Wellness: Rest easy with comprehensive health coverage through our Health Card
• Workspace Upgrade: Enhance your home office with our workspace upgrade allowance
• Monthly Internet Upgrade Incentive: Enjoy monthly internet upgrade incentives to keep you connected at top speeds
• Empowerment through Resources: Access a plethora of training resources, including design tools, to bolster your skill set
• Engage and Grow: Participate in a variety of engaging internal and external company events, such as culture-building activities and enriching workshops
• Free Lunch every Monday (a.k.a. Monchdays): Kickstart your week with complimentary lunch every Monday
• Recharge and Relax: Take advantage of paid vacation and sick leaves to ensure a healthy work-life balance
• Work-Life Integration: We foster a culture that values your overall well-being, allowing you to seamlessly integrate work and life

Title: UX Designer - Remote
Description:
Job Description

Long term permanent placement opportunity

Compensation: $2,500 USD/per month

Summary:

We seek a creative and detail-oriented UX/UI Designer to join our team. The UX/UI Designer will be responsible for designing and enhancing our digital products' user experience and user interface. This role requires expertise in user research, wireframing, prototyping, and front-end design principles to create engaging and visually appealing applications.

Key Responsibilities
• Design user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing interfaces for web and mobile applications.
• Conduct user research and usability testing and analyze user feedback to enhance design decisions.
• Develop wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to communicate design ideas effectively.
• Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with business objectives.
• Ensure consistency in design language, color schemes, typography, and branding across all digital products.
• Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best UX/UI design practices.
• Utilize design tools such as Figma to create high-fidelity designs.
• Work closely with front-end developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs.
• Create and maintain a design system to streamline development and improve user experience.

Requirements & Qualifications

• Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and usability best practices.

• Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Preferred Qualifications

Title: Web Designer and Landing Page Specialist (Part-Time)
Description:
We are seeking a Web Designer with hands-on experience using drag-and-drop website editors such as Google Sites, WordPress (with builders like Elementor), Squarespace, and Wix. The ideal candidate must also be proficient in Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator (or similar tools) to design headers and graphic elements. This role requires building, designing, and launching approximately 60 landing pages annually across multiple client accounts.

Strong communication skills are essential, as you will interact directly with clients to discuss changes, revisions, and project updates. This is a role for someone seasoned, organized, and creative — not for someone looking to learn on the job.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Landing Page Development & Design:
• Build, design, and launch approximately 60 custom landing pages per year using drag-and-drop platforms (Webflow, Unbounce, Google Sites, WordPress, Squarespace, Wix or similar).
• Customize templates or create layouts from scratch while ensuring responsive design and mobile optimization.
• Implement effective CTAs, forms, integrations, and checkout functions as needed.
• Ensure brand consistency across all client pages while adding creative, original touches.

2. Graphic & Visual Asset Creation:
• Design custom graphics, page headers, banners, and supporting visuals using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator (or equivalent programs).
• Create visually engaging assets that complement each landing page and enhance user experience.
• Maintain a library of reusable templates and brand assets for various client accounts.

3. Client Interaction & Communication:
• Serve as the primary point of contact for web design changes and updates for assigned clients.
• Attend review meetings, collect feedback, and translate client input into actionable design improvements.
• Present drafts, wireframes, and final products clearly to clients, ensuring satisfaction and alignment with brand goals.

4. Quality Assurance & Project Management:
• Conduct thorough quality checks for functionality, design accuracy, and responsiveness before page launches.
• Manage multiple landing page projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines without sacrificing quality.
• Document project updates and communicate status internally with the team.
• Stay current on best practices for SEO, web performance, and design trends to continuously improve deliverables.

Ideal Candidate:
• 3+ years experience in website design using platforms like Wix, Squarespace, Google Sites, or WordPress with drag-and-drop editors.
• Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator (or similar graphic design tools) is required.
• Strong understanding of web and mobile responsive design principles.
• Excellent client communication skills — both verbal and written.
• Highly organized with the ability to manage several projects at once.
• Creativity, attention to detail, and a strong aesthetic sense.
• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Bonus: Knowledge of basic SEO practices and UX/UI best practices.

Personal Attributes
• Creativity: Ability to think outside the box to create engaging and innovative content.
• Detail-Oriented: Ensures all posts are accurate, error-free, and aligned with brand guidelines.
• Adaptability: Comfortable working in a remote environment and adjusting to evolving client needs.
• Proactive: Continuously identifies opportunities to improve performance and engagement.
• Collaboration: Works effectively with teams to achieve business goals.

Job Type: Part-time

Benefits:
• Paid training
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

Title: Web & Marketing Designer – Work From Home
Description:
About ClinicMind

ClinicMind is the #1 EHR and practice management system for chiropractic clinics in the U.S.—and we’re just getting started.

We exist to fight back against the bloated, confusing, and often predatory systems that make healthcare harder than it should be. Insurance companies profit by delaying care, denying claims, and overwhelming providers with red tape. We're building software that helps practices beat them at their own game—so clinicians can focus on healing, not billing.

Thousands of practices already rely on us to thrive. Now, we’re expanding into mental health and general medicine, bringing our bold mission and proven tools to new providers across the country.

To do that, we need to tell our story better. We need a powerful web presence and marketing engine—one that resonates with purpose-driven practitioners and pushes the industry forward.

And that’s where you come in.

The Role

We’re hiring a Web & Marketing Designer to lead the redesign of ClinicMind.com and own the look and feel of our entire marketing experience—from social campaigns and email templates to digital ads, landing pages, and event materials.

This is more than a production role. It’s an opportunity to shape how the world sees a company that’s taking on one of the biggest challenges in healthcare—and winning.

You’ll be the sole Marketing Designer, collaborating closely with our Head of Design (focused on Product), while owning the end-to-end creative execution for Marketing. You’ll conduct research, define strategy, explore bold ideas, and bring it all to life with polished, conversion-minded design.

If you're a web designer with strong visual instincts, CMS fluency, and you want your design work to matter in the real world—to patients, providers, and an entire industry—this is your moment.

What You’ll Do
• Redesign ClinicMind.com: Own the full website redesign—from research and discovery to IA, prototyping, visual design, testing, and delivery. Your work will support brand awareness, customer conversion, and market expansion.
• Execute Marketing Creative: Design campaign assets, landing pages, social media graphics, event collateral, email templates, digital ads, and more.
• Champion Research: Conduct user and stakeholder research, synthesize insights, and translate them into actionable creative strategies.
• Evolve the Brand: Help refine and extend our visual identity to ensure brand consistency across all marketing and digital touchpoints.
• Collaborate with Teams: Work closely with Marketing, Product, and Sales to ensure creative alignment with business goals.
• Own the Craft: Deliver polished, thoughtful work that’s grounded in design thinking, brand systems, and user needs.

What We’re Looking For
• 3–5+ years of professional experience as a web or marketing designer
• Strong portfolio of responsive web designs, visual design work, and branded marketing assets
• Proficiency in Figma and a major design suite (Adobe CC, Affinity, etc.)
• Deep understanding of layout, typography, color, and hierarchy
• Mastery of CMS tools like Webflow, Framer, or WordPress
• Strong grasp of responsive design, accessibility standards, and design systems
• Familiarity with design thinking and human-centered design methodologies
• Ability to plan and conduct usability testing and basic research independently
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Must be available to work Monday–Friday, 9am–5pm Eastern Time

Bonus Points For
• Experience building or evolving brand systems for SaaS or B2B companies
• Background in healthcare, health tech, or other regulated industries
• Experience supporting marketing teams in fast-moving startup or scale-up environments
• Experience with 3D design tools (e.g., Blender, Cinema 4D, or similar) for event booth or environmental design
• Experience with A/B testing, user surveys, guerrilla testing, card sorting, and interviews
• Knowledge of SEO best practices or conversion rate optimization (CRO)
• Experience working on data-informed creative projects

Octal Philippines Inc. is looking for an innovative Frontend Web Designer to join our talented team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing user-friendly web interfaces that enhance the overall user experience. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to create visually appealing and functional websites that are consistent with our brand identity.

Your primary focus will be on converting design concepts into responsive, pixel-perfect web pages while ensuring a seamless user interaction across various devices.
• Proven experience as a Front-End Web Designer.
• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, Javascript and responsive layouts.
• Familiarity with web design tools such as InDesign and Photoshop

Title: Website Designer (Graphic Design + UX + SEO)
Description:
Job Title: Website Designer (Graphic Design + UX + SEO)

Job Type: Full-Time

Location: Philippines, Remote, M-F, 9AM-6PM, Pacific Time

Restriction: This opportunity is for candidates residing in the Philippines

Compensation: Competitive

The Digital Marketing Recruiters

Digital Marketing Recruiters has been in the digital marketing and recruitment space for over 25 years. We work with highly skilled marketing, digital marketing, and sales professionals and match them with our clients from diverse industries across the United States. Our selection process incorporates comprehensive resume screening, shortlisting, conducting video-recorded interviews and providing client information, administering written assessments (if required by the client), arranging client interviews, and facilitating job offers and placements.

The Client

The client doesn’t just manufacture insulated packaging—they engineer solutions for niche industries that demand precision, customization, and performance. As a leading manufacturer of custom thermal packaging solutions, they deliver cutting-edge insulation and refrigerant packs tailored to the specific needs of their customers. The client's ability to innovate and customize at scale, combined with their reputation for quality, reliability, and competitive pricing, fuels their growth—and they’re looking for a high-energy, innovative, and creative go-getter to take their marketing to the next level.

The Role

The client is looking for a highly creative and technically skilled Website Designer who blends artistic vision with UX and SEO expertise. This role is ideal for someone who can bring ideas to life through compelling visuals, ensure an exceptional user experience, and drive performance through SEO best practices.

As part of the digital team, you'll take the lead on web design projects, create custom graphics, support marketing efforts, and contribute to shaping a best-in-class online presence.

Key Responsibilities
• Design and build responsive, visually engaging elements for the company website.
• Create original graphics, illustrations, icons, and visual assets for web and marketing use.
• Design visuals for a variety of marketing materials, including social media images, email templates, case studies, sales presentations, and more.
• Develop wireframes, site layouts, and interactive prototypes with a user-centered approach.
• Collaborate closely with developers, marketers, and content creators to ensure brand consistency and functional integration.
• Implement SEO best practices across web assets, including metadata, semantic HTML, image optimization, and site speed enhancements.
• Monitor website performance and analyze user behavior using tools like Google Analytics and Hotjar to inform UX improvements.
• Stay current with design trends, UX strategies, SEO developments, and emerging web technologies.

Required Skills and Qualifications
• 3+ years of professional web design experience.
• Strong portfolio demonstrating web design, graphic design, and UX/UI capabilities.
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD) and/or Figma.
• Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and CMS platforms like WordPress (not required to code, but must be able to collaborate with devs).
• Working knowledge of SEO fundamentals, including on-page optimization, internal linking, and site architecture.
• Experience with responsive and mobile-first design principles.
• Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, and Hotjar or similar.
• Experience designing assets for Google Ads (AdWords) and local advertising campaigns.

Preferred Skills (nice to have)
• Experience with animation or motion graphics (e.g., Adobe After Effects, Lottie).
• Basic knowledge of JavaScript or modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Vue).
• Experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization (CRO).
• Background in branding or developing visual identity systems.
• Comfortable working in an agile or fast-paced startup environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• Health insurance

Work Location: In person

Title: Software QA Tester
Description:
The Software QA Tester is an entry level role within eScreen’s Quality Assurance team. This position involves manual testing of software changes, ensuring application functionality meets or exceeds the product owner’s and customer’s expectations and needs. The Software QA Tester will be required to follow testing practices and procedures, as well as applying proven testing techniques

The Software QA Tester is also be expected to understand and exhibit the importance of adhering to regulations (i.e. SOX, FDA, HIPAA, PCI, etc.) and is responsible for contributing to regulatory compliance.

As an important member of an Agile environment, the Software QA Tester is expected to cultivate, grow, and maintain core principals including, but not limited to, continuous improvement, self-organization, adaptive planning, and value driven development, using methodologies and frameworks such as LEAN, SCRUM, and KANBAN. Additionally, you will possess a growth-mindset, be team-oriented, have strong interpersonal skills, and possess the ability to deal with ambiguity; applicants must demonstrate an aptitude for team communication and collaboration.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Create written test solutions for user stories within a Scrum or Kanban team
• Work within team-defined commitment windows to provide value to our customers and clients
• Work with a Scrum or Kanban team to create solutions for stakeholders and clients
• Tests user interfaces, SQL databases, reports, APIs, and data transmissions
• Create tests, including test data, in a variety of testing environments
• Learn and demonstrate basic test automation skills and practices
• Learn and demonstrate software testing practices, methodologies, and techniques
• Use judgment within defined policies and practices
• Document and communicate issues and/or concerns discovered during sprints
• Assist in building a culture of learning and continuous improvement for the team (QA and SCRUM/KANBAN)
• Work with development and QA, displaying strong communication and collaboration skills
• Demonstrate an understanding of how applications are used by customers, clients, and internal support
• Work independently with moderate reliance on a more senior team member
• Follows the processes slated within the quality assurance department in accordance to all regulations (i.e. SOX, FDA/Quality, general controls)
• This position will also be required to work nights and weekends as needed to support development efforts and to perform production release validations

Title: Manual QA Tester (Mid-Senior Level)
Description:
Pointwest is looking for a Manual QA Tester to join our Insurance Business Unit. This role is key to delivering high-quality software through detailed testing, clear defect reporting, and active collaboration with cross-functional teams. You will contribute to project success by ensuring product reliability while aligning with Pointwest's core values of Leadership, Excellence, and Innovation, and our culture of Agility, Accountability, Collaboration, Customer Centricity, and Innovation.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, execute, and maintain test plans and test cases based on requirements.
• Conduct functional, regression, and exploratory testing to ensure product quality.
• Log and track bugs through test management and defect tracking tools.
• Collaborate with developers, analysts, and project stakeholders to resolve defects and improve test outcomes.
• Provide clear documentation of testing processes, risks, and issues.
• Support quality initiatives, share best practices, and contribute to team learning and process improvement.

Performance Metrics
• Customer & Stakeholder Satisfaction: Timely and accurate defect reporting; consistent communication with stakeholders; positive client feedback.
• Business Growth Contribution: Reduction in production defects; on-time QA deliverables; support for client retention through quality assurance.
• Process Improvement: Suggestions implemented; reusable test assets created; participation in retrospectives and QA audits.
• Learning & Development: Training hours completed; certifications attained (e.g., ISTQB); peer contributions and knowledge-sharing.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
• Relevant experience in manual QA testing (preferably in insurance or financial domains).
• Familiar with QA methodologies, test case design, and bug tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, TestRail).
• Basic understanding of programming languages like Java, Python, or C# is a plus.
• Test automation or performance testing experience is an advantage.
• Detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive problem-solver.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• ISTQB certification or similar is a plus.
• Must embody Pointwest’s values of Leadership, Excellence, and Innovation, and demonstrate our culture of Agility, Accountability, Innovation, Collaboration, and Customer Centricity.

Ready to make an impact through quality? Apply now and help us deliver excellence to our clients!

Title: QA Analyst
Description:
The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure that quality monitoring is conducted for BUs or processes assigned, considering regulatory and business requirements. The QA Analyst trending and analysis of the transaction monitoring results at the team and individual level and recommends performance improvements or enhancements to procedures and standards, if warranted.

The QA Analyst serves as back-up of the QA Officer in case of absence and may be delegated tasks that are handled by them.

Key Results Area

Major Activities

Output

Operational Excellence
• Quality-check transactions processed or completed by the assigned BU; ensure these are timely and accurately done and recorded
• Report critical error findings to avoid recurrence (daily), escalate as necessary
• Use quality monitoring data management system/tool to compile and track performance of team and individual
• Document the checking/audit process in workflows and manuals, ensuring these are updated when guidelines change
• Provide feedback to the BU and the immediate supervisor on urgent findings
• Coach BU staffs who are underperforming in terms of quality, as requested
• Assist in data gathering and investigations for escalated cases
• Track reported errors from clients and distributors
• Assist in designing, creating, and implementing quality initiatives and standards
• Submit quality results to the BU as scheduled; and analyze these results on a monthly basis, both at the team and individual level
• Assist the immediate supervisor in conducting a deep-dive on findings to arrive at the root cause, especially on highly visible, high-impact, or recurring issues
• Make recommendations to the BU to manage unacceptable variation, as a result of quality checking and analyses
• Act as the expert during QC calibrations
• Act as trainer when new hires come in
• May be tasked to coach QA Associates or Specialists
• Coordinate and facilitate process calibration sessions with the assigned BU
• Conduct (unannounced) side-by-side or remote monitoring
• Participate in or facilitate monthly and quarterly BU reviews
• Perform ad hoc tasks that may be assigned from time to time
• Completed quality log
• Quality scores, individual and team
• Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
• Audit workflows and manuals
• Trending and analysis

Customer Centricity
• Consolidate reported and escalated errors from clients and distributors, and profile and coordinate with the BU and other departments to resolve and put in place appropriate controls; assist in monitoring action plans and timelines
• Participate in customer engagement programs to understand customer needs and expectations
• Make recommendations on enhancements to improve the overall customer experience
• Correlate quality results to CSAT and/or D-Scope; make recommendations on aligning quality attributes to CSAT and/or D-Scope results
• Alignment of survey to quality attributes/parameters
• Improvement recommendations (process, etc.)

Stakeholder Management
• Conduct regular business review with stakeholders
• Regularly coordinate with other departments on changes in guidelines or regulations
• Manage relationships and agreements with internal/external customers
• Respond to escalated queries/concerns from customers, internal and external
• Communicate with customers and other parties on sensitive matters in a timely and effective manner
• Corrective action plan recommendation
• Customer satisfaction

Key Decisions/Dimensions

Decisions

Quantifiable Data Related to Job
• Pass/Fail for QC calibration
• Completed QC, per agreed sampling size
• Timeliness of reports
• %pts improvement of BU scores
• Valid disputes by BUs
• Completed/documented process calibration sessions with BUs
• QC calibration results
• Checking documentations (maps and manuals)
• Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
• Coaching documentations
• Analyses on reported and escalated errors

Your Profile

Educational Qualifications

Relevant Experience
• Graduate of a 4-year degree course
• Minimum 3 years’ work experience
• Experience in quality, data, and/or business analysis
• Experience in (BU) reporting
• Process knowledge an advantage
• Insurance background is a plus

Personal Characteristics and Behaviors

Other Requirements
• Keen to details and focus on quality; works with integrity
• Good interpersonal skills
• Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
• Presentation skills
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
• Strong time management skills
• Ability to adapt and multitask
• A team player
• Works with less supervision
• Must be proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
• Can work with data; numerate
• Must be able to effectively deal with people at all levels inside and outside of the Company
• Quality Management training

About AXA

A global leader in insurance and investments, AXA takes care of 103 million lives in 64 countries worldwide. We actively invest in pioneering and personalized solutions to meet your ever-changing needs and exceed your expectations. In the Philippines, we are in partnership with Metrobank, one of the country's strongest banks.
About the Entity

Established in 1999, AXA Philippines is one of the largest and fastest growing life insurance companies in the country. It offers financial security to more than one million individuals through its group and individual life insurance as well as general insurance products through its subsidiary Charter Ping An.

AXA Philippines is one of the first to introduce bancassurance operations in the country, and is among the pioneers in the investment-linked insurance sector.

AXA now offers a complete range of products for all its customers’ insurance and financial protection needs, including savings and investments, health plans, income protection, and health coverage; and through its general insurance subsidiary Charter Ping An Insurance Corporation: fire, motor car, marine cargo, personal accident, bonds, casualty, and engineering insurance products.

AXA Philippines closed 2017 with P26.4 billion in total premium income and P5.7 billion in gross written premiums from Charter Ping An. Today, AXA has more than 4,000 financial advisers in 36 branches, and 700 financial executives in over 900 Metrobank and PSBank branches nationwide. Charter Ping An, on the other hand, has 22 branches nationwide and 2,007 agents.

AXA Philippines is a joint venture between the AXA Group, headquartered in France, and the Metrobank Group, one of the largest financial conglomerates in the Philippines.

The Metrobank Group is a conglomerate of industry-leading businesses that includes First Metro Investment Corporation, Metrobank Credit Cards, Federal Land, Toyota, and Manila Doctors Hospital. It was hailed Best Bank in the Philippines in 2010, 2011, and 2012 by Euromoney and recognized as the strongest bank in the Philippines by The Asian Banker in 2013. It is owned by the Ty Family whose major business interests include financial services, real estate development, power, and manufacturing.
What We Offer
Please visit www.axa.com.ph/careers for more information.

Title: QA Analyst (Remote / Philippines)
Description:
QA Analyst (Ivalua Experience Preferred)

The Role

We are looking for an experienced and energetic leader to join the team as a QA Analyst (Remote - Philippines). We are seeking an experienced QA professional who is detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about maintaining the highest standards of quality. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality, reliability, and performance of our software solutions.

Modali believes in giving each person a chance to succeed: you will be afforded the opportunities, resources, and autonomy to deliver quality, timely projects to our diverse client base.

TO APPLY: Please submit an application using the link on our website, modaliconsulting.com.

Responsibilities
• Design and develop comprehensive test strategies and plans that encompass functional, integration, regression, and performance testing to validate software functionality and user experience.
• Create, review, and execute test cases, test scripts, and test scenarios based on project requirements, user stories, and technical documentation.
• Identify, document, and communicate software defects, inconsistencies, and issues using appropriate tools and methodologies. Work closely with developers and project stakeholders to resolve issues promptly.
• Develop and maintain automated test scripts to streamline regression testing, improve testing efficiency, and enhance overall test coverage.
• Execute tests and monitor test results, analyzing discrepancies and proactively escalating potential roadblocks to the project team. Generate detailed test reports and metrics to communicate progress and quality status.
• Collaborate with development and product teams to enhance the QA process by providing feedback and insights for improving software quality, performance, and user experience.
• Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, user stories, and technical specifications, ensuring alignment between development and testing efforts.
• Conduct performance and load testing to identify bottlenecks, assess system scalability, and ensure optimal software performance under various conditions.
• Perform regular regression testing to validate new features, enhancements, and bug fixes while maintaining the integrity of existing functionalities.
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date testing documentation, including test plans, test cases, test data, and test results, ensuring comprehensive coverage and knowledge sharing within the team.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a QA Analyst or similar role in software testing.
• Strong understanding of QA methodologies, tools, and best practices.
• Proficiency in automated testing tools and frameworks.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
• Familiarity with Agile development processes.
• ISTQB or other relevant certifications are a plus.
• Preferences:
• Ivalua L2 or L3 Certification strongly preferred
• At least 1 year of configuration experience within e-procurement, system implementation, and consulting

Salary, Benefits, Additional Information
• This position is remote and expected to be based out of the Philippines.
• We anticipate a 40-hour workweek.
• We can be flexible with work hours and allow for a schedule that suits your needs.
• You will be hired as an independent contractor. This means that you will be responsible to pay for your own taxes and contributions voluntarily.
• Additionally, we utilize a time tracking software that is required to track time and work.
• Additional pay for local healthcare contribution.
• Potential for international travel to Europe and United States.
• 13th month pay.
• Internet allowance.

About

Who we are. Modali Consulting is a technology strategy and consulting firm, supporting private and public sector clients across a range of industries. Its primary capabilities are in data engineering, data science, project management, software development and design, analytics strategy, and solutions. Clients range from state and local governments, to Big 4 consulting firms, to product companies.

Modali Consulting prides itself on its staff and culture above all else because we are convinced that investing in people yields the best results. Its core principles are: (1) transparency and intellectual humility; (2) responsibility to each other; (3) commitment to challenging conventions; (4) failing forward and repeating success; and (5) fostering a cohesive and collaborative work environment for clients and employees alike. To learn more, go to www.modaliconsulting.com.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. Modali Consulting is an inclusive equal opportunity employers committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, or gender identity.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
Description

Role:
• Act as subject-matter expert regarding DevSecOps related areas, tools and processes both in Azure cloud.
• Develop Azure cloud-based and internal tools and processes to maintain stability and performance of our infrastructure.
• Build, maintain, and troubleshoot several internal applications and respond to and resolve production issues.
• Gather, analyze, and report system monitoring.
• Deploy, maintain, and manage Azure cloud-based production systems ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
• Build and scale web-based tools and solutions tailored for business needs.
• Conduct security reviews and implement improvements to meet compliance and governance standards.
• Operate effectively in an Agile environment, collaborating cross-functionally with development and operations teams.
• Design, build, and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines for reliable delivery of applications and services.
• Leverage container orchestration frameworks (e.g., Kubernetes) to manage deployment workflows.
• Mentor team members and promote knowledge sharing and collaborative problem-solving.

Qualifications

The Requirements:
• 8+ years of experience in DevOps or cloud engineering roles.
• Strong experience with Azure infrastructure, tools, and services.
• 3+ years of experience using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Bicep, ARM, etc.
• Proficient in source code management tools: GitHub, Azure DevOps, GitLab, Bitbucket.
• Hands-on experience with container-based infrastructure and production deployments.
• Proficient in monitoring and logging tools such as New Relic, Prometheus, Splunk, AppInsights.
• Strong programming/scripting experience with Bash, PowerShell, Python, or similar.
• Familiarity with automation tools like Selenium, Playwright, etc.
• Frontend/backend development experience is a plus (React, Angular, C#, Java, .NET).
• In-depth understanding of cloud security, application security, SAST, and DAST practices.
• Experience with incident response, troubleshooting, and participating in on-call rotations.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently with minimal oversight.
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or other related field, or equivalent work experience.
• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, and zero-defect mentality. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision or assistance.
• Strong problem-solving skills: innovation, collaboration, analysis, inductive reasoning.
• Good understanding of technology and its application to any business process

Preferred Skills
• Experience in Azure, Azure DevOps, Run books and automation
• Languages & Tools: PowerShell, PowerBI
• Technologies: Cloud Architecture, ARM templates, Bicep, SQL

WTW is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: DevOps Engineer 3
Description:
We would love for you to explore other opportunities within Asurion.
Asurion is seeking Dev Ops engineer who is passionate about learning new technology and love problem-solving. At Asurion, we don’t just redefine—we reinvent. We began by establishing a culture that rewards results and isn’t confined by a hierarchy. As a result, we have achieved phenomenal growth. Today, this entrepreneurial spirit is as strong as ever. It’s in our DNA. We foster a culture where our team members are encouraged daily to make a difference—for our clients, customers, and themselves. Our dynamic and rewarding environment ensures that each of our 17,000+ team members can reach their full potential, while at the same time fulfilling the needs of more than 280 million consumers.

The Account Management platform team builds and maintains systems that support customer enrollment processing and vendor communication. We focus on providing a seamless stakeholder experience by reliably executing product initiatives and providing highly responsive customer service.
We are looking for highly motivated technologists with an interest in building and maintaining resilient, fault-tolerant systems, monitoring the infrastructure and the passion and curiosity to learn. If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Asurion is seeking Dev Ops engineer who is passionate about learning new technology and love problem-solving. At Asurion, we don’t just redefine—we reinvent. We began by establishing a culture that rewards results and isn’t confined by a hierarchy. As a result, we have achieved phenomenal growth. Today, this entrepreneurial spirit is as strong as ever. It’s in our DNA. We foster a culture where our team members are encouraged daily to make a difference—for our clients, customers, and themselves. Our dynamic and rewarding environment ensures that each of our 17,000+ team members can reach their full potential, while at the same time fulfilling the needs of more than 280 million consumers.

The Account Management platform team builds and maintains systems that support customer enrollment processing and vendor communication. We focus on providing a seamless stakeholder experience by reliably executing product initiatives and providing highly responsive customer service.
We are looking for highly motivated technologists with an interest in building and maintaining resilient, fault-tolerant systems, monitoring the infrastructure and the passion and curiosity to learn. If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Key Accountabilities:

• Build utilities and tools to automate the troubleshooting and maintain playbooks
• Build UI and dashboards for monitoring ETL flows, API transactions across the stack
• Develop, manage and follow operational policies and procedures including documentation and training
• Participate in shifts, on-call rotation while building systems to minimize critical outages.

• Utilizes design patterns that comply with security policies , oversee and promote best security practices
• Ensures the appropriate adherence to Asurion's inter-departmental processes and procedures within the testing team.
• Provides proper status notifications are relayed to business stakeholders and Client Relations for internal and external communications through the approved protocols.
• Influence and Drive the team towards capitalizing the development hours, compared to the Operational hours.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electronics ,Mathematics, or a related field required
• 5+ Years of Software development experience is required.
• 3+ years with CI/CD and Build systems (Jenkins, or other)
• 2+ Years experience on Cloud services (preferably AWS)
• 2+ years of experience with merging code into Git-based system (Bitbucket, GitHub, or other)

• Familiarity with source control systems (Bitbucket, Github) is nice to have
• Familiarity with monitoring frameworks – Elastic Stack (ELK), Prometheus, Splunk or similar frameworks, is nice to have
• Familiarity with orchestration tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Cloud Formation) is nice to have
• Working in flexible hours schedule

Title: IT.Lead DevOps Engineer | Makati City, PH
Description:
IT.Lead DevOps Engineer

Job Description

About Citco

Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 80 offices worldwide. With more than $1 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients' needs.

For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com

About the Team & Business Line:

Proprietary software solutions and innovation are at the core of what differentiates Citco in the alternative investment space. Through our network of global development centers, Citco invests heavily in technology development, security, and infrastructure to ensure our clients continue to receive award-winning products that underpin our commitment to service excellence.

As a core member of our Product Development team you will work with dedicated professionals to ensure our clients maintain access to their critical information assets while keeping Citco ahead of industry trends.

Your Role:

As a Cloud DevOps Lead, you will be managing a cross-functional team that will be responsible for designing and implementing re-usable frameworks, APIs, CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, test automation leveraging modern cloud native designs/patterns and AWS services.

You will be part of a culture of innovation where you'll use AWS services to help team solve business challenges such as rapidly releasing products/services to the market or building an elastic, scalable, cost optimized application. You will have the opportunity to shape and execute a strategy to build knowledge and broaden use of public cloud in a dynamic professional environment.

• Implement end-to-end highly scalable, available and resilient cloud engineering solutions for infrastructure and application components using AWS.
• Implement CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and applications.
• Write infrastructure automation scripts, templates and integrate with DevOps tools.
• Automate smoke test and integrate test automation scripts such as unit tests, integration tests, performance tests into the CI/CD process.
• Troubleshoot AWS environments.
• Manage a team of skilled DevOps Engineers and be able to work well across functions.
• Prioritize and oversee multiple projects in a fast-paced environment by effectively managing time and meet deadlines.
• Serve as a focal point to communicate and resolve interface and integration issues with other teams.
• Create a team environment which promotes trust, open communication, creative thinking, and cohesive team effort.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills.

About You:

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
• At least 8 years in IT or Software Engineering.
• At least 3 years of AWS DevOps experience.
• Working experience in leading a team of DevOps engineers.
• Working experience in creating and managing the following AWS resources from scratch:
• CloudFormation and IAM
• CodePipeline, CodeBuild and CodeDeploy
• Load Balancers, Auto Scaling, EC2, EFS and ECS Fargate
• Batch and Lambda (Python)
• RDS, DynamoDB and S3
• CloudWatch Logs, Alarms, Metrics and Dashboards
• Working experience in creating Docker images and Jenkins pipelines from scratch.
• Working experience in creating resources from scratch with Terraform.
• Working experience in Git, Python and Shell scripting.
• Working experience in Kubernetes and EKS.
• Working experience in setting up and troubleshooting AWS production environments.
• Working experience in implementing end to end CI/CD Delivery pipelines.
• Must be self-motivated and driven to motivate a team to succeed.
• Strong documentation skills and ability to train and mentor team members.
Our Benefits

Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation's evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.

Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

Title: DevOps Support Engineer MI-GR
Description:
Embark on your path towards a successful career. Kuehne+Nagel stands out as an innovative logistics company with adaptability and efficiency at our core. Our advanced processes enable us to deliver exceptional services to our clients and customers. Your knowledge, expertise and distinct skillsets will play a vital role in driving the organization’s growth. Your Role
The primary purpose of the Development Infrastructure Support Engineer is to ensure the optimal performance and availability of Kuehne + Nagel's IT infrastructure, providing services for continuous integration and delivery for cross-functional teams of developers, testers and business analysts. The role focuses on maintaining robust infrastructure solutions that support the company's logistics operations globally. The engineer is responsible for troubleshooting and resolving infrastructure issues to minimize downtime and ensure seamless operations. Additionally, the role contributes to the digital transformation strategy by deploying modern technologies and automation solutions. Your Responsibilities
• Operates primarily in a dynamic office environment, providing support via video conference, email and chat.
• Engages in collaborative work with IT teams and logistics departments, utilizing advanced productivity and development software to stay abreast of technological advancements.
• Collaborates closely with IT colleagues, infrastructure teams and external vendors to ensure seamless integration and operation of IT infrastructure within the logistics framework.
• Handles technical requests and questions about Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines.
• Monitors and maintains build pipeline infrastructure to ensure optimal functionality, promptly addressing any issues to minimize operational disruptions.
• Coordinates handling of support tickets.
• Maintains tutorials and documentation for technical solutions.
Your Skills and Experiences
• Bachelor's degree in information technology, Computer Science or in any related field.
• Strong understanding of IT Infrastructure and operations.
• Demonstrates experience in managing and maintaining complex IT Systems, including CI/CD, Jenkins and AWS components, preferably within the logistics industry.
• Exhibits proficiency in modern technologies and automation tools, with a commitment to continuous learning and adaptation to emerging trends in IT and Logistics.
Good Reasons to Join
We offer opportunities where you can grow your expertise, shape processes and deliver innovative solutions. We are continuously growing our local and global network and our product portfolio creating career opportunities in different fields of work worldwide. We deliver high quality solutions to our customers and are proud to be a leader in the logistics industry.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have an extensive background in Agile methodologies, Linux scripting, and Azure DevOps pipelines, along with deep expertise in Oracle RDBMS and SQL. This role requires a proactive leader with a keen eye for monitoring, security management, and ITIL processes.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead the implementation and management of Agile methods and Scrum practices.
• Develop and maintain complex Linux (bash) scripts for automation and process improvement.
• Design, build, and maintain Azure DevOps pipelines (or similar CI/CD tools).
• Manage and optimize Oracle RDBMS 12c or higher, including Oracle SQL.
• Monitor system performance and ensure observability using SRE principles.
• Handle vulnerability management and patching to maintain system security.
• Oversee ITIL processes, including incident, problem, and change management.
• Mentor and guide junior team members.

Must-Have Qualifications:
• Proficiency in Agile methods and Scrum.
• Strong Linux (bash) scripting capabilities.
• Extensive experience with Azure DevOps pipelines (or similar CI/CD tools).
• Deep expertise in Oracle RDBMS 12c or higher and Oracle SQL.
• Proven experience in monitoring, alerting, and observability (SRE).
• Knowledge of vulnerability management and patching.
• Solid understanding of security management.
• Familiarity with ITIL processes: incident, problem, and change management.
• Leadership and mentoring skills.

Nice-to-Have Qualifications:
• Experience with Kafka (cluster management, Kafka connect, schema registry, etc.).
• Skills in visualization tools like Grafana, Elastic, and Kibana.
• Experience working in a complex, corporate environment.
• Understanding of Database Change Data Capture concepts and Oracle Goldengate.
• Knowledge of Oracle Data Integrator 12c or any ETL tool.
• Experience in lending and financial systems.
• Familiarity with issue trackers like JIRA and ServiceNow.
• Proficiency in collaboration tools like Confluence.
• Experience with batch scheduling tools.
• Knowledge of file transfer protocols like XFB.

Title: Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer
Description:
ABOUT TRIBUTE TECHNOLOGY:

At Tribute Technology, we make end-of-life celebrations memorable, meaningful, and effortless through thoughtful and innovative technology solutions. Our mission is to help communities around the world celebrate life and pay tribute to those we love. Our comprehensive platform brings together software and technology to provide a fully integrated experience for all users, whether that is a family, a funeral home, or an online publisher. We are the market leader in the US and Canada, with global expansion plans and a growing international team of more than 400 individuals in the US, Canada, Philippines, and Ukraine.

ABOUT YOU:

Tribute Technology is looking for a collaborative and motivated Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer!

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in cloud infrastructure, automation, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. The Cloud DevOps Engineer will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and secure cloud environments to support our applications and services.

The Cloud DevOps Engineer will be instrumental in driving our cloud strategy and ensuring the efficient and secure operation of our cloud-based systems. If you are passionate about cloud technologies, automation, and continuous improvement, we would love to hear from you.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

○ Cloud Skills:
• Extensive experience with cloud architectures, particularly AWS.
• Proficient in administering AWS services such as ECS, CloudFront, CloudFormation/Terraform, CloudWatch, IAM, and more.

○ Continuous Deployment (CD):
• Develop and maintain automated pipelines, integrating various tools to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.

○ Containers:
• Manage and support container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes, enhancing scalability and flexibility.

○ Observability:
• Implement Application Performance Monitoring (APM) solutions such as New Relic.
• Expertise in components like CloudWatch, CloudWatch Events and Alarms, syslogs, and other cloud analytics tools.

○ Infrastructure as Code (IaC):
• Automate repetitive tasks using IaC principles with tools like Terraform, streamlining the deployment of containers and EC2 instances.

○ Release Management:
• Support developers with release issues, build automated release frameworks, integrate test automation into CI/CD processes, and ensure seamless code releases.

○ Security:
• Understand and apply AWS security best practices to protect infrastructure from potential threats.

○ IT Operations:
• Strong troubleshooting skills, effective server resource management, and database management knowledge (SQL and NoSQL databases).
• Experience with Linux and Windows servers.

○ Automation:
• Expertise in scripting languages and automation technologies such as AWS Lambda, CloudWatch, and SNS for event-driven patterns.

Title: DevOps Application Engineer
Description:
Employment type: Permanent

Location: Makati City, Metro Manila

Work setup: Hybrid (open to 2x a week in the office)

Pay range: Php 60,000 to Php 81,000

Discover a world of endless possibilities with Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a distinguished global academic publisher and assessment organisation proudly affiliated with the prestigious University of Cambridge.

We are looking for an Application Engineer who will be part of the Manila Application Engineers team. As a key member of our team, you are responsible for supporting business application systems for Cambridge University Press and Assessment, running in Cloud platforms, such as AWS and Azure, and On-Premise Linux and Windows Operating Systems.

Why Cambridge?

At Cambridge, our unwavering commitment is to excel in education, learning, and research on a global scale. With a presence in over 170 countries, we empower millions of individuals, unlocking their potential and enabling their success. From dedicated teachers shaping young minds to visionary researchers pushing the boundaries of knowledge, we embody a relentless pursuit of enlightenment, curiosity, and understanding.

We embrace change as an opportunity for growth and progress, constantly adapting to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Collaboration and attentive listening are at the heart of our journey, as we work hand in hand with our customers and each other to innovate and discover more effective ways to achieve our goals. We believe people thrive in an environment where Trust and Empowerment are at the forefront, which is why all our new team members are provided regularisation on their first day so they can start #PursuingPotential from day one.

Joining Cambridge means becoming a part of an extraordinary institution renowned worldwide. Beyond that, you'll become a part of a vibrant and forward-thinking community that transcends tradition, fostering a culture of continuous growth and personal development. Here, we provide the perfect environment for you to thrive, supporting your professional journey and empowering you to reach your highest potential.

What can you get from Cambridge?

In this role, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues from diverse branches, expanding your horizons and enriching your understanding of different cultures. We value your wellbeing and offer stability, fostering your professional and personal growth through internal and external activities and training sessions to help enrich your skillset.

Enjoy work-life balance flexibility through our range of options, including flexible schedules, hybrid work arrangements, and generous paid leave. As a regular employee on Day One, you'll have access to comprehensive healthcare benefits, ensuring your peace of mind with coverage for dependents, group life insurance, and robust well-being programs.

What will you do in this role?

As an Application Engineer, you will play a critical role in managing and planning the implementation of projects, works on day-to-day provision of technology support, and manage maintenance activities. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Manage and prepare for the implementation of projects in the operational/support environments including evaluation, feasibility, technical investigations, pilots, and proof of concepts, training and knowledge transfer to and from other support teams. Describe the key result areas (not the individual tasks) that this role is expected to deliver. Start with the most important. These can be unique to the organisation.

What makes you the ideal candidate in this role?
• Education & Experience: Degree or equivalent experience with at least 3 years in AWS Cloud Engineering, Architecture, or Infrastructure in a Systems Admin or DevOps role.
• System Administration & ITIL: Proficiency in Unix and Windows administration, ITIL best practices, incident management, service requests, and change management.
• DevOps & CI/CD: Experience with DevOps practices and CI/CD tools such as AWS CodePipeline, Jenkins, and Terraform.
• Cloud & Virtualization: Strong knowledge of AWS and Azure, troubleshooting cloud environments, and experience with virtualization technologies like VMware and Hyper-V.
• AWS Infrastructure: Familiarity with AWS services including EC2, ECS, Fargate, Route53, CloudWatch, API Gateway, Lambda, AWS databases, and networking.
• Application & Scripting: Experience in web hosting (IIS, Apache Tomcat), Java and .NET application support, and scripting in Shell, PowerShell, Bash, Java, or Python.
• Networking & Security: Understanding of networking concepts, firewalls, load balancers, and database technologies.
• Directory Services & Service Management: Knowledge of Active Directory, LDAP, DNS, DHCP, and service management processes.

Deadline of application submission is on April 12, 2025, but may close early if we receive sufficient applications. Therefore, if you are interested, please submit your application as early as possible. Whilst not essential, it is very advantageous if you submit a Cover Letter alongside your CV.

Please review the attached job description for further details on the role.

Title: Manager, DevOps Engineering
Description:
We would love for you to explore other opportunities within Asurion.

We are seeking an experienced Manager, DevOps Engineering to take ownership of our cloud and data center infrastructure across Asurion’s APAC platforms. In this role, you will play a key part in delivering reliable and scalable technology solutions that underpin our services, including device protection, tech support, trade-in programs, and more.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• End-to-End Ownership of Infrastructure: Managing the platform infrastructure across various APAC product suites, including Device Protection, Upgrade, Open Market, Trade-In, and Direct to Consumer. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure that technological solutions align with overall business objectives and strategies. Lead and manage IT system enhancements and implementation projects.
• Day-to-Day Infrastructure Support Management: Responsible for dealing with day-to-day IT Infrastructure and DevOps activities across both on-premises and cloud data centres in the APAC region.
• Drive Standardization: Standardize the infrastructure procedures and processes across all locations of data centres and cloud hosting. Develop and implement a comprehensive DevOps strategy aligned with the goals and objectives of Asurion IT & Security Governance. Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code practices to automate the provisioning and configuration of infrastructure components.
• Leading DevOps & Infrastructure Teams: Lead and mentor a team of DevOps professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture. Oversee the establishment and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines for efficient and automated software delivery and manage infrastructure and desktop support team members spanned across the multiple countries in APAC region.
• Collaboration & Governance: Coordinating with the global network teams, security teams, regional platform development and client solution engineering teams (offshore) to ensure that infrastructure requirements are fulfilled to support and manage the client rollouts on time.
• Security Governance: Security is the paramount importance in Asurion, so this position is fully responsible to work together with Global DevOps, Platform Security, Enterprise Architecture, Legal, and Compliance to make sure that the infrastructure of APAC platforms is meeting all necessary Asurion platform security standards as part of continuous improvement to the platforms. This role will work with global security teams to implement the latest security frameworks and best practices to APAC platform infrastructure to address all kinds of security vulnerabilities, threads and risks, including regular audits.

Here’s what you’ll bring to the team:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering (all branches), math, or a related field is required. A master’s degree or equivalent qualification is preferred.
• At least 10+ years of experience in IT Infrastructure, DevOps, and Information Security, with 5+ years of strong experience managing large-scale infrastructure on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
• AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional or equivalent certifications preferred.
• Strong familiarity with tools like Jenkins, Ansible, and Terraform for streamlining infrastructure setup, deployment, and management.
• Comprehensive experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, including managing large-scale infrastructure and deploying applications.
• Proficient in tools like Docker and Kubernetes for packaging, orchestration, and efficient application deployment and expertise in using code and scripting to set up, automate, and manage technical systems, including servers and cloud environments.
• Proven track record of fostering DevOps practices, emphasizing collaboration, efficiency, transparency, and continuous improvement in software development and operations.
• Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot technical issues, propose effective solutions, and ensure projects stay on track while addressing infrastructure and operations challenges.
• Strong ability to convey technical concepts clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders, manage expectations, and provide updates to leadership.
• Skilled in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, and related automation tools with in-depth understanding of security best practices for infrastructure, applications, and DevOps processes, including knowledge of networking protocols, authentication, cloud security, and applied cryptography.
• Knowledgeable in leveraging AI/ML and Generative AI to automate DevOps tasks such as deployments, monitoring, and alerting.
• Adept at overseeing multiple projects, managing timelines, and delivering results within deadlines while ensuring alignment with business priorities.
• An effective team player capable of sharing knowledge and supporting team goals while also working independently and making sound decisions, eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies.
• Skilled in engaging with offshore-based teams for development, support, and operational management.

About Asurion

At Asurion, every one of us is a leader, from individual contributors to the senior team. We utilize our 5 Leadership Principles to help align and guide us in our everyday interactions.
• Put Customers First
• Play A Team Sport
• Take Ownership
