In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing user-friendly web interfaces that enhance the overall user experience. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to create visually appealing and functional websites that are consistent with our brand identity.

Your primary focus will be on converting design concepts into responsive, pixel-perfect web pages while ensuring a seamless user interaction across various devices.
• Proven experience as a Front-End Web Designer.
• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, Javascript and responsive layouts.
• Familiarity with web design tools such as InDesign and Photoshop
• Experience in responsive and adaptive design principles.
• Knowledge of SEO best practices and web performance optimization.
• A strong portfolio showcasing previous design work and projects.
• Strong communication skills and excellent attention to detail.

THIS WORK IS FREELANCE ONLY 20HRS PER WEEK

Title: Web & Marketing Designer – Work From Home
Description:
About ClinicMind

ClinicMind is the #1 EHR and practice management system for chiropractic clinics in the U.S.—and we’re just getting started.

We exist to fight back against the bloated, confusing, and often predatory systems that make healthcare harder than it should be. Insurance companies profit by delaying care, denying claims, and overwhelming providers with red tape. We're building software that helps practices beat them at their own game—so clinicians can focus on healing, not billing.

Thousands of practices already rely on us to thrive. Now, we’re expanding into mental health and general medicine, bringing our bold mission and proven tools to new providers across the country.

To do that, we need to tell our story better. We need a powerful web presence and marketing engine—one that resonates with purpose-driven practitioners and pushes the industry forward.

And that’s where you come in.

The Role

We’re hiring a Web & Marketing Designer to lead the redesign of ClinicMind.com and own the look and feel of our entire marketing experience—from social campaigns and email templates to digital ads, landing pages, and event materials.

This is more than a production role. It’s an opportunity to shape how the world sees a company that’s taking on one of the biggest challenges in healthcare—and winning.

You’ll be the sole Marketing Designer, collaborating closely with our Head of Design (focused on Product), while owning the end-to-end creative execution for Marketing. You’ll conduct research, define strategy, explore bold ideas, and bring it all to life with polished, conversion-minded design.

If you're a web designer with strong visual instincts, CMS fluency, and you want your design work to matter in the real world—to patients, providers, and an entire industry—this is your moment.

What You’ll Do
• Redesign ClinicMind.com: Own the full website redesign—from research and discovery to IA, prototyping, visual design, testing, and delivery. Your work will support brand awareness, customer conversion, and market expansion.
• Execute Marketing Creative: Design campaign assets, landing pages, social media graphics, event collateral, email templates, digital ads, and more.
• Champion Research: Conduct user and stakeholder research, synthesize insights, and translate them into actionable creative strategies.
• Evolve the Brand: Help refine and extend our visual identity to ensure brand consistency across all marketing and digital touchpoints.
• Collaborate with Teams: Work closely with Marketing, Product, and Sales to ensure creative alignment with business goals.
• Own the Craft: Deliver polished, thoughtful work that’s grounded in design thinking, brand systems, and user needs.

What We’re Looking For
• 3–5+ years of professional experience as a web or marketing designer
• Strong portfolio of responsive web designs, visual design work, and branded marketing assets
• Proficiency in Figma and a major design suite (Adobe CC, Affinity, etc.)
• Deep understanding of layout, typography, color, and hierarchy
• Mastery of CMS tools like Webflow, Framer, or WordPress
• Strong grasp of responsive design, accessibility standards, and design systems
• Familiarity with design thinking and human-centered design methodologies
• Ability to plan and conduct usability testing and basic research independently
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Must be available to work Monday–Friday, 9am–5pm Eastern Time

Bonus Points For
• Experience building or evolving brand systems for SaaS or B2B companies
• Background in healthcare, health tech, or other regulated industries
• Experience supporting marketing teams in fast-moving startup or scale-up environments
• Experience with 3D design tools (e.g., Blender, Cinema 4D, or similar) for event booth or environmental design
• Experience with A/B testing, user surveys, guerrilla testing, card sorting, and interviews
• Knowledge of SEO best practices or conversion rate optimization (CRO)
• Experience working on data-informed creative projects

Title: Web Designer UI/UX - Remote
Description:
YourTeamCloud
Remote Position
Salary DOE
Job Type: Full-Time, Part-Time, or Per-Project
Highlights

Great work environment
Meaningful work with US clients

Why Your Team Cloud?
Your Team Cloud (YTC) is a US-based web development company with a Philippines branch that supports an elite group of US companies. We provide a stable income, a supportive team, and mentoring, along with fun and challenging projects that make a real impact on the businesses we serve.

Team Members are encouraged to contribute and share their ideas to help the company and the companies we serve be more successful. As we are a small and fast-growing company, you will get unique opportunities to learn a variety of skills and paid time for improving your existing skillset.
Job Description
Our designers are a core part of our team. They strategically translate customer briefs into attractive, user-friendly designs that advance company values and goals.

The ideal candidate’s style is unique, modern & clean.
Key Designer Qualities:

Original/Creative
Detail oriented
Proactive
Ambitious
Communicative
A team player
Hardworking

Position Qualifications
Previous Experience

Career Level: 1-4 Years of Experience

Software Proficiency

Illustrator - Including quickly creating custom icons, logos, and illustrations.
Adobe XD - Creating complete website wireframes and designs.
Photoshop - Including detailed photo manipulation and beautiful, properly layered print flier and banner designs.
Figma - Rapidly creating detailed website and app designs.

Common Duties
Day-to-day work is performed thoroughly and efficiently, mindful of how design tasks fit into larger project timelines.

Design Tasks

Branding: Create a branding guide for clients which will become a blueprint for creative designs (logo, color selection, font selection, layout requirements, etc.)
Wireframing: Designing the website at the structural level establishing the flow of design solutions taking into account design briefs.
UI / UX designs: Proper and logical execution of design elements and prototypes to make the user experience seamless and understand the target audience's mindset.

Design for websites: Convert copy into attractive, story-driven website designs with properly executed graphics.
Design for print media: Produce properly sized and colored designs as required for print items, including banners, magazines, flyers, eBooks, t-shirts, etc.

General Expectations

Collaboration with developers: Meet with developers to plan designs so the transition from design to development is seamless.
Research: Find or provide design inspiration to help clients visualize the target outcome.
Training: Continuous self-improvement using company-provided relevant training and seminars.

Company Overview
Company Size: 1 - 50 Employees

Industry: Computer / Information Technology (Software)

Workday: 12 AM - 9 AM, Mondays to Fridays

Your Team Cloud has been an innovation and technology partner on over 100 projects for startups and enterprises in various industries. Our top priority is creating websites, features, automation, and marketing solutions that help the companies we serve make more money, save time and run more efficiently.

Title: Web Designer (CRO+Webflow) at Fella Health — Remote, US Hours, $30k-$60k/yr inc equity
Description:
About Fella Health

Fella Health helps middle-aged men live 10 years longer.

We're the telemedicine clinic that understands bigger guys. We start by solving their most pressing healthcare need through GLP-1 medication, then stay with them for the long haul. Think of us less as a weight loss company and more as a life transformation partner.
Where are we now?
• We’ve grown >1000x since Aug 2021, >180x since Sept 2022, >10x since Nov 2023.
• We’ve just surpassed $30M ARR.
• As a company, we’ve been cashflow positive for the last 18mo.
• We’re approaching 10,000 fellas with high NPS.
• We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:
• Y Combinator
• Global Founders Capital — backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet
• AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)
• BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)
• The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)

Where are we going?

We will have served 10 million customers by the end of 2028. That's not a random number – it's our mission. We're still a young startup moving at intense speed. This is still Day 1, and we have a long way to go.

You can read more about working at Fella here: https://fella.notion.site/Working-at-Fella-14a2ac8575d34d148d009bb410387af4

We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:
• Y Combinator
• Global Founders Capital — backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet
• AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)
• BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)
• The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)

The opportunity as Web Designer

As a Web Designer at Fella Health, you’ll design and develop high-converting landing pages and quiz funnels. This role is focused on execution, not brand creation — you’ll be implementing visual assets into performance-first designs that directly impact results. You’ll work closely with our CRO Specialist and Lead Designer to create landing pages that can be adapted across multiple brands. While we currently use Webflow as our primary platform, we’re also exploring a move to Shopify or other platforms — so being able to implement front end code and use no-code tools at the same time is important .

You’ll receive fast, direct feedback and will be expected to iterate quickly. We’re looking for someone who can move fast, take ownership, and consistently deliver high-converting pages.

Over time, you'll become a key player in the development of new customer journeys, working hand-in-hand with the rest of the team to create designs that significantly improve our Lead > Sale conversion rate.

This is a full-time remote role.

You'll report directly to our Lead Designer (@Marjoe Bacus), CRO Specialist (@Emiliano), work closely with Frontend Engineer (@Art), Head of Growth (Dave Lane) & CEO (Richie Cartwright).

Key Responsibilities
• Straight away
• Design for core conversions
• Collaborate: Work closely with the design team and the CRO Specialist to understand the optimization roadmap and identify design opportunities across funnels.
• Design: Create visually appealing and user-centric designs, focusing on improving page layouts, visual hierarchy, and calls to action to lift conversion rates.
• Iterate: Based on test results and insights from the CRO Specialist, iterate on designs to further optimize performance and implement winning variants across the site.
• Enhance design systems for testing - Develop and maintain design components and templates that facilitate efficient testing and ensure consistency across the site.
• In the near future
• Expand design's impact on the customer journey - Collaborate with the Ore, our CRO Specialist to design optimized experiences beyond the site, including ads, email, and product flows. You'll create visually compelling and persuasive designs that influence core KPIs e.g. CAC & LTV.

Need to Have
• Design expertise: 3+ years of experience designing high performing landing pages and websites for existing brands and startups (not template or concept works) and a portfolio that showcases this. Skilled in creating visually compelling and user-centric designs that effectively guide users towards desired actions.
• Proficiency in design and web development tools: Strong command of design tools such as Figma, Webflow, or Adobe Creative Suite.
• Webflow and No-code tools: Experience with building websites using webflow and understand front-end development and able to implement custom code.
• Collaboration skills: Proven ability to work closely with Design, CRO, Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams to understand optimization goals and translate them into impactful designs.
• Full funnel design perspective: Understanding of how design impacts the entire customer journey, from awareness to retention. Ability to create cohesive and persuasive experiences across touchpoints.
• Attention to detail: Meticulous in ensuring design consistency, adhering to brand guidelines, and maintaining design systems across the site and various touchpoints.

Nice to Have
• Previous experience with CRO: Familiarity with conversion rate optimization principles and techniques. Experience designing for A/B and multivariate tests is a strong plus.
• Storytelling through design: Skilled at using visual design to communicate complex ideas and guide users through narratives that drive conversions.
• Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced environment. Able to quickly iterate on designs based on changing requirements and new insights. Experience with Shopify and able to use other no-code tools and graphic design skills are a plus.

Our cultural standards

These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:
• Belief in the mission: We will have served 10 million patients by the end of 2028 and we transform the life of most patients who join. We have a lot of work to do. We are obsessed with our patients and are dedicated to the mission.
• Unwavering integrity: We are at the frontier, so we often live in ambiguity with no trodden path. When we can’t look to others for guidance, we must maintain impeccable ethics and unwavering integrity.
• Only the paranoid survive: Bad sh*t is coming. By joining us, you’re choosing to sail straight towards the storms with unhesitating conviction. However much we’ve already done, however far we’ve already come — it’s still Day 1 and all our work is ahead of us.
• Your life’s work: This will be your most challenging, most rewarding role of your life. You’ll be shocked how capable you are & how much you can achieve.
• If we’re average we fail: We are only interested in “insanely great”, a focus on the quality of our execution that in everyday life would be considered pathological. We have a dedication to excellence and reject incompetence.
• Commitment to candor: That which can be destroyed by the truth should be. You get full transparency from the company and the company expects full transparency from you. We never say anything about someone that we wouldn’t say to them directly. We give feedback with love and do not need to protect people from fleeting physical sensations.
• A maniacal sense of urgency: We execute at an intensity that most people think is impossible. Speed is critical and we need things done yesterday. We all work very hard and in such a competitive world there really is no other way to win.
• Enduring frugality: We are frugal. We hate being wasteful and we are anti-luxury. A culture of cheapness keeps us young. We spend our cash wisely & carefully — in a way that would make our grandmas proud.
• Bulldozing barriers: The world is malleable and we shape it. We truly believe this and act accordingly. We are relentlessly resourceful and are at the mercy of no-one but ourselves.
• Keep your head down: We’re boring people doing exciting work. We don’t chase short-term status — we ignore short-term dopamine hits and focus on what matters. Outsiders will underestimate us and we revel in that.
• The power of focus: We live in a world of power laws and we cannot overestimate the unimportance of practically everything. Know your One Thing, and nail it.

🎯 “You just build a fing amazing experience. Make each step amazing. Make every decision in the long term interest of the customer. Give the customer massively more value than you take.”*

Compensation & Benefits
• Compensation: $30k-$60k/yr inc equity
• Healthcare: comprehensive medical insurance (if appropriate)
• Vacation: PTO with a yearly minimum (≥2wks/yr + local national holidays)
• Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely
• Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching
• Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps
• Coaching: free biweekly health coaching
• Equipment: Macbook & work-from-home equipment provided as needed
• What are we missing? We're still early so you get to shape our culture.

How to apply

Apply via Ashby and be sure to include the following:
• your resume & portfolio (a solid web design portfolio)
• highlights from your experience relevant for the role (webflow websites that you built, landing page design examples that convert, ideally from a funnel)

Title: Software QA Tester
Description:
The Software QA Tester is an entry level role within eScreen’s Quality Assurance team. This position involves manual testing of software changes, ensuring application functionality meets or exceeds the product owner’s and customer’s expectations and needs. The Software QA Tester will be required to follow testing practices and procedures, as well as applying proven testing techniques

The Software QA Tester is also be expected to understand and exhibit the importance of adhering to regulations (i.e. SOX, FDA, HIPAA, PCI, etc.) and is responsible for contributing to regulatory compliance.

As an important member of an Agile environment, the Software QA Tester is expected to cultivate, grow, and maintain core principals including, but not limited to, continuous improvement, self-organization, adaptive planning, and value driven development, using methodologies and frameworks such as LEAN, SCRUM, and KANBAN. Additionally, you will possess a growth-mindset, be team-oriented, have strong interpersonal skills, and possess the ability to deal with ambiguity; applicants must demonstrate an aptitude for team communication and collaboration.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Create written test solutions for user stories within a Scrum or Kanban team
• Work within team-defined commitment windows to provide value to our customers and clients
• Work with a Scrum or Kanban team to create solutions for stakeholders and clients
• Tests user interfaces, SQL databases, reports, APIs, and data transmissions
• Create tests, including test data, in a variety of testing environments
• Learn and demonstrate basic test automation skills and practices
• Learn and demonstrate software testing practices, methodologies, and techniques
• Use judgment within defined policies and practices
• Document and communicate issues and/or concerns discovered during sprints
• Assist in building a culture of learning and continuous improvement for the team (QA and SCRUM/KANBAN)
• Work with development and QA, displaying strong communication and collaboration skills
• Demonstrate an understanding of how applications are used by customers, clients, and internal support
• Work independently with moderate reliance on a more senior team member
• Follows the processes slated within the quality assurance department in accordance to all regulations (i.e. SOX, FDA/Quality, general controls)
• This position will also be required to work nights and weekends as needed to support development efforts and to perform production release validations

Title: Senior QA Tester- Remote - Manila, Philippines
Description:
Introduction

At Slipstream IT we work to streamline IT Support and provide managed solutions with a strategic consulting and global leadership management approach. Our solutions are designed exclusively for emerging pharma and biotech organizations.

Slipstream’s industry-leading solutions free clients from the demands of internal IT and allow them to rapidly advance their mission. Led by a leadership team that has been together for over 10 years, you will join a proven team, culture, and strategy to drive innovation within the IT outsourcing industry while developing your skillset with the opportunities for internal growth.

Responsibilities
• Lead and execute end-to-end testing processes, including functional, regression, smoke, usability, and localization testing for mobile (iOS) and web-based applications.
• Develop, maintain, and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts.
• Analyze business requirements and technical specifications to ensure complete test coverage.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, business analysts) to identify risks, resolve issues, and improve product quality.
• Manage and maintain multiple QA environments; track and prioritize defects through the entire lifecycle.
• Utilize tools like DevTools, Jira, and Azure DevOps for defect tracking and test management.
• Conduct import/export data validation and testing across supported platforms.
• Support the continuous improvement of QA processes and testing strategies.

Required Qualifications
• 8+ years of hands-on experience in software testing.
• Strong expertise in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
• Deep understanding of QA principles, testing types, and industry best practices.
• Experience with mobile testing on iOS and responsive web application testing.
• Familiarity with tools such as Postman (API testing), DevTools, Jira, and Azure DevOps.
• Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create well-structured documentation and articulate quality concerns effectively.

Preferred Skills (Nice to Have)
• Experience with Postman or other API testing tools.
• Prior experience working in CI/CD environments.
• Familiarity with test automation tools is a plus.

Benefits
• 401k match
• Comprehensive group health, dental, vision benefits
• Life insurance/LTD
• Discretionary PTO
• Salary: $20,000-$30,000 USD Annually

Slipstream IT is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation or identity, national origin, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws. Slipstream IT makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

This job description may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the job described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of the Employer.

Title: QA Analyst
Description:
The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure that quality monitoring is conducted for BUs or processes assigned, considering regulatory and business requirements. The QA Analyst trending and analysis of the transaction monitoring results at the team and individual level and recommends performance improvements or enhancements to procedures and standards, if warranted.

The QA Analyst serves as back-up of the QA Officer in case of absence and may be delegated tasks that are handled by them.

Key Results Area

Major Activities

Output

Operational Excellence
• Quality-check transactions processed or completed by the assigned BU; ensure these are timely and accurately done and recorded
• Report critical error findings to avoid recurrence (daily), escalate as necessary
• Use quality monitoring data management system/tool to compile and track performance of team and individual
• Document the checking/audit process in workflows and manuals, ensuring these are updated when guidelines change
• Provide feedback to the BU and the immediate supervisor on urgent findings
• Coach BU staffs who are underperforming in terms of quality, as requested
• Assist in data gathering and investigations for escalated cases
• Track reported errors from clients and distributors
• Assist in designing, creating, and implementing quality initiatives and standards
• Submit quality results to the BU as scheduled; and analyze these results on a monthly basis, both at the team and individual level
• Assist the immediate supervisor in conducting a deep-dive on findings to arrive at the root cause, especially on highly visible, high-impact, or recurring issues
• Make recommendations to the BU to manage unacceptable variation, as a result of quality checking and analyses
• Act as the expert during QC calibrations
• Act as trainer when new hires come in
• May be tasked to coach QA Associates or Specialists
• Coordinate and facilitate process calibration sessions with the assigned BU
• Conduct (unannounced) side-by-side or remote monitoring
• Participate in or facilitate monthly and quarterly BU reviews
• Perform ad hoc tasks that may be assigned from time to time
• Completed quality log
• Quality scores, individual and team
• Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
• Audit workflows and manuals
• Trending and analysis

Customer Centricity
• Consolidate reported and escalated errors from clients and distributors, and profile and coordinate with the BU and other departments to resolve and put in place appropriate controls; assist in monitoring action plans and timelines
• Participate in customer engagement programs to understand customer needs and expectations
• Make recommendations on enhancements to improve the overall customer experience
• Correlate quality results to CSAT and/or D-Scope; make recommendations on aligning quality attributes to CSAT and/or D-Scope results
• Alignment of survey to quality attributes/parameters
• Improvement recommendations (process, etc.)

Stakeholder Management
• Conduct regular business review with stakeholders
• Regularly coordinate with other departments on changes in guidelines or regulations
• Manage relationships and agreements with internal/external customers
• Respond to escalated queries/concerns from customers, internal and external
• Communicate with customers and other parties on sensitive matters in a timely and effective manner
• Corrective action plan recommendation
• Customer satisfaction

Key Decisions/Dimensions

Decisions

Quantifiable Data Related to Job
• Pass/Fail for QC calibration
• Completed QC, per agreed sampling size
• Timeliness of reports
• %pts improvement of BU scores
• Valid disputes by BUs
• Completed/documented process calibration sessions with BUs
• QC calibration results
• Checking documentations (maps and manuals)
• Daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
• Coaching documentations
• Analyses on reported and escalated errors

Your Profile

Educational Qualifications

Relevant Experience
• Graduate of a 4-year degree course
• Minimum 3 years’ work experience
• Experience in quality, data, and/or business analysis
• Experience in (BU) reporting
• Process knowledge an advantage
• Insurance background is a plus

Personal Characteristics and Behaviors

Other Requirements
• Keen to details and focus on quality; works with integrity
• Good interpersonal skills
• Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
• Presentation skills
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
• Strong time management skills
• Ability to adapt and multitask
• A team player
• Works with less supervision
• Must be proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
• Can work with data; numerate
• Must be able to effectively deal with people at all levels inside and outside of the Company
• Quality Management training

About AXA

A global leader in insurance and investments, AXA takes care of 103 million lives in 64 countries worldwide. We actively invest in pioneering and personalized solutions to meet your ever-changing needs and exceed your expectations. In the Philippines, we are in partnership with Metrobank, one of the country's strongest banks.
About the Entity

Established in 1999, AXA Philippines is one of the largest and fastest growing life insurance companies in the country. It offers financial security to more than one million individuals through its group and individual life insurance as well as general insurance products through its subsidiary Charter Ping An.

AXA Philippines is one of the first to introduce bancassurance operations in the country, and is among the pioneers in the investment-linked insurance sector.

AXA now offers a complete range of products for all its customers’ insurance and financial protection needs, including savings and investments, health plans, income protection, and health coverage; and through its general insurance subsidiary Charter Ping An Insurance Corporation: fire, motor car, marine cargo, personal accident, bonds, casualty, and engineering insurance products.

AXA Philippines closed 2017 with P26.4 billion in total premium income and P5.7 billion in gross written premiums from Charter Ping An. Today, AXA has more than 4,000 financial advisers in 36 branches, and 700 financial executives in over 900 Metrobank and PSBank branches nationwide. Charter Ping An, on the other hand, has 22 branches nationwide and 2,007 agents.

AXA Philippines is a joint venture between the AXA Group, headquartered in France, and the Metrobank Group, one of the largest financial conglomerates in the Philippines.

The Metrobank Group is a conglomerate of industry-leading businesses that includes First Metro Investment Corporation, Metrobank Credit Cards, Federal Land, Toyota, and Manila Doctors Hospital. It was hailed Best Bank in the Philippines in 2010, 2011, and 2012 by Euromoney and recognized as the strongest bank in the Philippines by The Asian Banker in 2013. It is owned by the Ty Family whose major business interests include financial services, real estate development, power, and manufacturing.
What We Offer
Please visit www.axa.com.ph/careers for more information.

Title: QA Tester II
Description:
Requisition Number: 100263

QA Tester II

Location: This is a hybrid opportunity in Ortigas Center, Pasig City area.

Insight at a Glance
• 14,000+ engaged teammates globally
• #20 on Fortune’s World's Best Workplaces™ list
• $9.2 billion in revenue
• Received 35+ industry and partner awards in the past year
• $1.4M+ total charitable contributions in 2023 by Insight globally

Now is the time to bring your expertise to Insight. We are not just a tech company; we are a people-first company. We believe that by unlocking the power of people and technology, we can accelerate transformation and achieve extraordinary results. As a Fortune 500 Solutions Integrator with deep expertise in cloud, data, AI, cybersecurity, and intelligent edge, we guide organisations through complex digital decisions.

About the role

As a Quality Assurance Tester ll, you will enter a high-energy and tech savvy world. We are looking for someone who has a minimum of two years of work experience in this field, exceptional interpersonal skills, is customer service focused, and has a proven track record of delivering best in class software solutions. Successful QA Testers can adapt quickly to changing technical and professional environments.

As a QA Tester II, you will get to:
• Provide both quality control techniques and quality assurance practices to help ensure the continued high level of quality in Insight business systems
• Assess accuracy of the application, by creating and executing test plans, test scripts and test cases, ensuring test cases/user stories are testable, using Insight's documented methodology and established documentation
• Review business requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
• Ensure the documented requirements/user stories are addressed throughout the cycle and quality product is delivered to functional partners
• Work with the functional units to define various levels of application testing including functional (positive and negative), load, stress, and general regression testing. 
• Coordinate with the product owners, functional and technical analysts on automated and manual testing; as well as associated Super Users in determining the quality of our applications.
• Collaborate with the Development Technical Infrastructure group to ensure all environments are properly aligned to support testing objectives
• Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities

Be AmbITious: This opportunity is not just about what you do today but also about where you can go tomorrow. When you bring your hunger, heart, and harmony to Insight, your potential will be met with continuous opportunities to upskill, earn promotions, and elevate your career.

What we’re looking for:
• Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university or equivalent combination of education and experience
• 2 years of experience developing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans, test cases as well as experience in testing business applications
• Experience using tools, i.e. Jira (Atlassian), Selenium, Load Runner, Keynote and Unified Functional Testing (UFT) to perform functional, automated, load, performance, and/or stress testing
• Should have good understanding of the Testing concepts such as smoke testing, regression testing, integration testing, user acceptance testing, verification, severity, priority, validation, test plan and test case creation.
• Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize, plan and execute a goal
• Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
• Experience and knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle, Waterfall and Agile methodologies is a plus

What to Expect

We’re legendary for taking care of our teammates. We want you to enjoy a full, meaningful life and stick around Insight for the long haul.

We offer all the benefits you expect—health, dental, vision, PTO—plus:
• Health Insurance Available on Day 1 of employment (HMO) with 2 free dependents
• Onsite set-up
• Group Life Insurance
• Freedom to work from another location—even an international destination—for up to 30 consecutive calendar days per year.

But what really sets us apart are our core values of Hunger, Heart, and Harmony, which guide everything we do, from building relationships with teammates, partners, and clients to making a positive impact in our communities.

Join us today, your ambITious journey starts here.

When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

At Insight, we celebrate diversity of skills and experience so even if you don’t feel like your skills are a perfect match - we still want to hear from you!

The position described above provides a summary of some the job duties required and what it would be like to work at Insight. For a comprehensive list of physical demands and work environment for this position, click here.

About Insight

Today, every business is a technology business. Insight Enterprises, Inc. empowers organizations of all sizes with Insight Intelligent Technology Solutions™ and services to maximize the business value of IT. As a Fortune 500-ranked global provider of digital innovation, cloud/data center transformation, connected workforce, and supply chain optimization solutions and services, we help clients successfully manage their IT today while transforming for tomorrow. Title: QA Tester
Description:
About us:
At Amber, we're always on the hunt for the most talented individuals in the industry to join our team. We offer attractive compensation packages and plenty of chances to grow with us, and we're always on the lookout for ways to do things better. About the role:
Are you a stubborn person who's not afraid of searching for a needle in a haystack?
Bugs are your first love?
Are you an ardent learner who's always looking to improve?
Join us and you’ll have the opportunity to work on various platforms, from Android to iOS and
Windows or Facebook and on high profile games of top partners.

• Ability to learn, plan and be organized
• Open and honest approach to challenges
• Understanding of business needs and pressures in relation to testing operations
• Provide a positive role model, in terms of both work performance and attitude

Awesome to have:
• Experience with test case creation and basic test planning knowledge.
• Previous experience with mobile and web platforms (Android, iOS, Windows, Facebook).
• Previous experience with testing freemium games as well as the ability to analyze monetization systems.
The Reward:

• Professional and friendly work environment.
• A competitive compensation package.
• Awesome and talented colleagues.
• Support from all your teammates.
• Access to training and learning programs.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
Description

Role:
• Act as subject-matter expert regarding DevSecOps related areas, tools and processes both in Azure cloud.
• Develop Azure cloud-based and internal tools and processes to maintain stability and performance of our infrastructure.
• Build, maintain, and troubleshoot several internal applications and respond to and resolve production issues.

• Build and scale web-based tools and solutions tailored for business needs.

Qualifications

The Requirements:
• 8+ years of experience in DevOps or cloud engineering roles.

• Proficient in source code management tools: GitHub, Azure DevOps, GitLab, Bitbucket.

• Proficient in monitoring and logging tools such as New Relic, Prometheus, Splunk, AppInsights.

Preferred Skills
• Experience in Azure, Azure DevOps, Run books and automation

Title: DevOps Engineer 3
Description:
We would love for you to explore other opportunities within Asurion.
Asurion is seeking Dev Ops engineer who is passionate about learning new technology and love problem-solving. At Asurion, we don’t just redefine—we reinvent. We began by establishing a culture that rewards results and isn’t confined by a hierarchy. As a result, we have achieved phenomenal growth. Today, this entrepreneurial spirit is as strong as ever. It’s in our DNA. We foster a culture where our team members are encouraged daily to make a difference—for our clients, customers, and themselves. Our dynamic and rewarding environment ensures that each of our 17,000+ team members can reach their full potential, while at the same time fulfilling the needs of more than 280 million consumers.

The Account Management platform team builds and maintains systems that support customer enrollment processing and vendor communication. We focus on providing a seamless stakeholder experience by reliably executing product initiatives and providing highly responsive customer service.
We are looking for highly motivated technologists with an interest in building and maintaining resilient, fault-tolerant systems, monitoring the infrastructure and the passion and curiosity to learn. If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Asurion is seeking Dev Ops engineer who is passionate about learning new technology and love problem-solving. At Asurion, we don’t just redefine—we reinvent. We began by establishing a culture that rewards results and isn’t confined by a hierarchy. As a result, we have achieved phenomenal growth. Today, this entrepreneurial spirit is as strong as ever. It’s in our DNA. We foster a culture where our team members are encouraged daily to make a difference—for our clients, customers, and themselves. Our dynamic and rewarding environment ensures that each of our 17,000+ team members can reach their full potential, while at the same time fulfilling the needs of more than 280 million consumers.

The Account Management platform team builds and maintains systems that support customer enrollment processing and vendor communication. We focus on providing a seamless stakeholder experience by reliably executing product initiatives and providing highly responsive customer service.
We are looking for highly motivated technologists with an interest in building and maintaining resilient, fault-tolerant systems, monitoring the infrastructure and the passion and curiosity to learn. If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Key Accountabilities:
• Maintains a working knowledge of Asurion's applications and system integration and is able to understand changes in order to anticipate cross-system or cross-process impacts.
• Triage, deep-dive, and troubleshoot issues that arise in APIs and ETL Workflows – and implement a fix or upgrade the code to resolve the gap.
• Build utilities and tools to automate the troubleshooting and maintain playbooks
• Build UI and dashboards for monitoring ETL flows, API transactions across the stack
• Develop, manage and follow operational policies and procedures including documentation and training
• Participate in shifts, on-call rotation while building systems to minimize critical outages.
• Effectively communicates the feasibility of requested deliverables and timelines to the Manager and/or Sr. Manager
• Utilizes design patterns that comply with security policies , oversee and promote best security practices
• Ensures the appropriate adherence to Asurion's inter-departmental processes and procedures within the testing team.
• Provides proper status notifications are relayed to business stakeholders and Client Relations for internal and external communications through the approved protocols.
• Influence and Drive the team towards capitalizing the development hours, compared to the Operational hours.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electronics ,Mathematics, or a related field required
• 5+ Years of Software development experience is required.
• 3+ years with CI/CD and Build systems (Jenkins, or other)
• 2+ Years experience on Cloud services (preferably AWS)
• 2+ years of experience with merging code into Git-based system (Bitbucket, GitHub, or other)
• Exposure to maintaining Software Infrastructure and Operational activities is recommended.
• Previous experience in systems monitoring and team wide communication platforms is recommended

Competencies:
• Knowledge of Javascripts (React, Nodejs) is required
• Knowledge of SQL queries is required
• Knowledge of monitoring servers, file systems (on-premises or cloud-based) is preferred
• Knowledge of Python, PowerShell, shell scripting or similar experience is preferred
• Familiarity with file transfer tools and protocols (FTP, SFTP, SSH etc.) is preferred
• Understanding of networking protocols (TCP, sockets etc.) is nice to have
• Familiarity with source control systems (Bitbucket, Github) is nice to have
• Familiarity with monitoring frameworks – Elastic Stack (ELK), Prometheus, Splunk or similar frameworks, is nice to have
• Familiarity with orchestration tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Cloud Formation) is nice to have
• Working in flexible hours schedule

About Asurion

At Asurion, every one of us is a leader, from individual contributors to the senior team. We utilize our 5 Leadership Principles to help align and guide us in our everyday interactions.
• Put Customers First
• Play A Team Sport

Asurion helps more than 300 million people around the world unlock their technology's untapped potential. Partnering with leading wireless carriers, retailers and pay-tv providers, Asurion's 16,000 employees deliver a seamless, award-winning customer experience, anticipating their needs and providing tailored services reachable within one touch.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Remote (PH)
Description:
Senior DevOps Engineer

Position Type: Full-Time

Compensation: Up to PHP 137,000

Job Location: Remote

Job Highlights:

2. High Compensation Tied to Business Outcomes: You will be well-rewarded for meeting critical objectives and deadlines.
4. Empowerment & Resources: We will provide the right tools and teams to help you succeed on your own terms.
6. Flexibility & Accountability: You will have autonomy to structure your approach, but must deliver results.

16. Work-Ready: We provide the essential work device for seamless productivity.

Company Overview:

Theoria Medical is a comprehensive medical group and technology company dedicated to serving patients across the care continuum with an emphasis on post-acute care and primary care. Theoria serves facilities across the United States with a multitude of services to improve the quality of care delivered, refine facility processes, and enhance critical relationships. We offer a broad scope of services including multispecialty physician services, telemedicine, remote patient monitoring, and more. We currently operate primary care clinics and provide medical services to skilled nursing facilities in numerous states across the nation.

As a leading edge, innovative, and quality driven physician group, we continue to expand nationally. In pursuit of this, we continue to seek talented individuals to join our amazing team and care for our population. We wish to extend a warm welcome to all candidates interested in making a difference in healthcare delivery by joining the Theoria team.

The Senior DevOps Engineer is responsible for implementing, maintaining, and optimizing DevOps practices across development and operations teams. This role ensures efficient, reliable, and scalable delivery pipelines through CI/CD automation, infrastructure as code, and proactive system monitoring. The Senior DevOps Engineer collaborates closely with developers, QA, and operations teams to drive best practices and process improvements that support agile software delivery.

Shift Structure:

• TBA

Responsibilities:

• CI/CD and Infrastructure Automation

• Design, implement, and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines.
• Manage infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
• Automate provisioning, deployment, and monitoring workflows to ensure consistent and repeatable environments.

• Process Optimization and Tooling

• Recommend and implement DevOps tools and practices that increase efficiency and reduce manual effort.
• Optimize build, test, and deployment processes for speed and reliability.
• Enforce DevOps best practices across environments and teams.

• Collaboration and Support

• Collaborate with development teams to integrate DevOps practices into the software development lifecycle.
• Work with operations to ensure infrastructure reliability, security, and scalability.
• Communicate effectively with the DevOps Lead and cross-functional stakeholders regarding project status, technical decisions, and improvements.

• Monitoring and Incident Response

• Set up and manage monitoring, alerting, and logging systems.
• Participate in incident response and post-mortem analysis to improve system resilience.

Requirements and Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
• 5+ years of experience in DevOps or related engineering roles.
• Strong experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps).
• Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation).
• Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
• Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
• Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python).
• Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).
• Solid understanding of version control (Git), Agile methodologies, and SDLC processes.
• DevOps certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Expert) are a plus.

Compensation and Benefits:

• 2 rest days per week
• 13th Month Pay

Employee must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily, with or without a reasonable accommodation. Employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.

Title: IT.Lead DevOps Engineer | Makati City, PH
Description:
IT.Lead DevOps Engineer

Job Description

About Citco

Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 80 offices worldwide. With more than $1 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients' needs.

For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com

About the Team & Business Line:

Proprietary software solutions and innovation are at the core of what differentiates Citco in the alternative investment space. Through our network of global development centers, Citco invests heavily in technology development, security, and infrastructure to ensure our clients continue to receive award-winning products that underpin our commitment to service excellence.

As a core member of our Product Development team you will work with dedicated professionals to ensure our clients maintain access to their critical information assets while keeping Citco ahead of industry trends.

Your Role:

As a Cloud DevOps Lead, you will be managing a cross-functional team that will be responsible for designing and implementing re-usable frameworks, APIs, CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, test automation leveraging modern cloud native designs/patterns and AWS services.

You will be part of a culture of innovation where you'll use AWS services to help team solve business challenges such as rapidly releasing products/services to the market or building an elastic, scalable, cost optimized application. You will have the opportunity to shape and execute a strategy to build knowledge and broaden use of public cloud in a dynamic professional environment.

• Implement end-to-end highly scalable, available and resilient cloud engineering solutions for infrastructure and application components using AWS.
• Implement CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and applications.
• Write infrastructure automation scripts, templates and integrate with DevOps tools.
• Automate smoke test and integrate test automation scripts such as unit tests, integration tests, performance tests into the CI/CD process.
• Troubleshoot AWS environments.
• Manage a team of skilled DevOps Engineers and be able to work well across functions.
• Prioritize and oversee multiple projects in a fast-paced environment by effectively managing time and meet deadlines.
• Serve as a focal point to communicate and resolve interface and integration issues with other teams.
• Create a team environment which promotes trust, open communication, creative thinking, and cohesive team effort.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills.

About You:

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
• At least 8 years in IT or Software Engineering.
• At least 3 years of AWS DevOps experience.
• Working experience in leading a team of DevOps engineers.
• Working experience in creating and managing the following AWS resources from scratch:
• CloudFormation and IAM
• CodePipeline, CodeBuild and CodeDeploy
• Load Balancers, Auto Scaling, EC2, EFS and ECS Fargate
• Batch and Lambda (Python)
• RDS, DynamoDB and S3
• CloudWatch Logs, Alarms, Metrics and Dashboards
• Working experience in creating Docker images and Jenkins pipelines from scratch.
• Working experience in creating resources from scratch with Terraform.
• Working experience in Git, Python and Shell scripting.
• Working experience in Kubernetes and EKS.
• Working experience in setting up and troubleshooting AWS production environments.
• Working experience in implementing end to end CI/CD Delivery pipelines.
• Must be self-motivated and driven to motivate a team to succeed.
• Strong documentation skills and ability to train and mentor team members.
Our Benefits

Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation's evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.

Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

• Utilize technical expertise and judgment to define and implement solutions that address business needs.
• Provide guidance and assurance in the design of solutions that align with established strategies and objectives.
• Collaborate with systems users to identify changes in requirements that enhance efficiency, integration, or cost savings.
• Support project goals by offering expertise and technical assurance for key system components, ensuring design integrity and supporting cost analysis.
• Conduct technical evaluations of products, tools, techniques, and methods to meet business objectives.
• Offer technical insights for design specifications of major computer systems and provide consultative support for their implementation.
• Contribute to the development of technical strategies.
• Engage in project work while maintaining support in a "business as usual" environment.
• Apply technical knowledge to comprehend the effects of technology changes and operations on the effectiveness and integrity of managed IT systems.
• Demonstrate a solid understanding of risk management, controls, and standard operating procedures.
• Possess strong knowledge of policies, regulations, and obligations relevant to technology and the supporting business operations.
• Maintain a focus on quality and attention to detail.
• Exhibit excellent documentation and communication skills.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Must Have:
• Proven leadership experience with a team of 5 or more members, including those at graduate and intern levels.
• Over 5 years of experience in DevOps or Mainframe Engineering.
• Fundamental professional experience in a relevant field.
• Experience in the Financial Services Industry is a plus.

Specific:
• Proficiency in JCL (Job Control Language) coding.
• Expertise in SAS (Statistical Analysis System) programming.
• Knowledge of ISPF (Interactive System Productivity Facility) and ISPF Dialogue Management Services.
• Familiarity with SDSF (Spool Display Search Facility).
• Expertise in RACF Security, including conducting security control design reviews to ensure compliance with organizational standards.
• Background or exposure in Audit, Risk, and Controls.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Nice to Have:
• Implement and uphold security best practices in daily responsibilities.
• 3-5+ years of experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) or Cyber Security, with a focus on IAM.
• Identify and pursue opportunities for process improvements within the team.
• Proactively identify, report, and address risk remediation tasks relevant to the role.
• Engage in the investigation and resolution of potential security incidents in IT systems.
• Contribute to the development and promotion of IT security policies, standards, and procedures.
• ** This is an onsite role based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam - relocation assistance will be provided ***

Title: Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer
Description:
ABOUT TRIBUTE TECHNOLOGY:

At Tribute Technology, we make end-of-life celebrations memorable, meaningful, and effortless through thoughtful and innovative technology solutions. Our mission is to help communities around the world celebrate life and pay tribute to those we love. Our comprehensive platform brings together software and technology to provide a fully integrated experience for all users, whether that is a family, a funeral home, or an online publisher. We are the market leader in the US and Canada, with global expansion plans and a growing international team of more than 400 individuals in the US, Canada, Philippines, and Ukraine.

ABOUT YOU:

Tribute Technology is looking for a collaborative and motivated Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer!

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in cloud infrastructure, automation, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. The Cloud DevOps Engineer will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and secure cloud environments to support our applications and services.

The Cloud DevOps Engineer will be instrumental in driving our cloud strategy and ensuring the efficient and secure operation of our cloud-based systems. If you are passionate about cloud technologies, automation, and continuous improvement, we would love to hear from you.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

○ Cloud Skills:
• Extensive experience with cloud architectures, particularly AWS.
• Proficient in administering AWS services such as ECS, CloudFront, CloudFormation/Terraform, CloudWatch, IAM, and more.

○ Continuous Deployment (CD):
• Develop and maintain automated pipelines, integrating various tools to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.

○ Containers:
• Manage and support container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes, enhancing scalability and flexibility.

○ Observability:
• Implement Application Performance Monitoring (APM) solutions such as New Relic.
• Expertise in components like CloudWatch, CloudWatch Events and Alarms, syslogs, and other cloud analytics tools.

○ Infrastructure as Code (IaC):
• Automate repetitive tasks using IaC principles with tools like Terraform, streamlining the deployment of containers and EC2 instances.

○ Release Management:
• Support developers with release issues, build automated release frameworks, integrate test automation into CI/CD processes, and ensure seamless code releases.

○ Security:
• Understand and apply AWS security best practices to protect infrastructure from potential threats.

○ IT Operations:
• Strong troubleshooting skills, effective server resource management, and database management knowledge (SQL and NoSQL databases).
• Experience with Linux and Windows servers.

○ Automation:
• Expertise in scripting languages and automation technologies such as AWS Lambda, CloudWatch, and SNS for event-driven patterns.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have an extensive background in Agile methodologies, Linux scripting, and Azure DevOps pipelines, along with deep expertise in Oracle RDBMS and SQL. This role requires a proactive leader with a keen eye for monitoring, security management, and ITIL processes.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead the implementation and management of Agile methods and Scrum practices.
• Develop and maintain complex Linux (bash) scripts for automation and process improvement.
• Design, build, and maintain Azure DevOps pipelines (or similar CI/CD tools).
• Manage and optimize Oracle RDBMS 12c or higher, including Oracle SQL.
• Monitor system performance and ensure observability using SRE principles.
• Handle vulnerability management and patching to maintain system security.
• Oversee ITIL processes, including incident, problem, and change management.
• Mentor and guide junior team members.

Must-Have Qualifications:
• Proficiency in Agile methods and Scrum.
• Strong Linux (bash) scripting capabilities.
• Extensive experience with Azure DevOps pipelines (or similar CI/CD tools).
• Deep expertise in Oracle RDBMS 12c or higher and Oracle SQL.
• Proven experience in monitoring, alerting, and observability (SRE).
• Knowledge of vulnerability management and patching.
• Solid understanding of security management.
• Familiarity with ITIL processes: incident, problem, and change management.
• Leadership and mentoring skills.

Nice-to-Have Qualifications:
• Experience with Kafka (cluster management, Kafka connect, schema registry, etc.).
• Skills in visualization tools like Grafana, Elastic, and Kibana.
• Experience working in a complex, corporate environment.
• Understanding of Database Change Data Capture concepts and Oracle Goldengate.
• Knowledge of Oracle Data Integrator 12c or any ETL tool.
• Experience in lending and financial systems.
• Familiarity with issue trackers like JIRA and ServiceNow.
• Proficiency in collaboration tools like Confluence.
• Experience with batch scheduling tools.
• Knowledge of file transfer protocols like XFB.

Title: DevOps Application Engineer
Description:
Employment type: Permanent

Location: Makati City, Metro Manila

Work setup: Hybrid (open to 2x a week in the office)

Pay range: Php 60,000 to Php 81,000

Discover a world of endless possibilities with Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a distinguished global academic publisher and assessment organisation proudly affiliated with the prestigious University of Cambridge.

We are looking for an Application Engineer who will be part of the Manila Application Engineers team. As a key member of our team, you are responsible for supporting business application systems for Cambridge University Press and Assessment, running in Cloud platforms, such as AWS and Azure, and On-Premise Linux and Windows Operating Systems.

Why Cambridge?

At Cambridge, our unwavering commitment is to excel in education, learning, and research on a global scale. With a presence in over 170 countries, we empower millions of individuals, unlocking their potential and enabling their success. From dedicated teachers shaping young minds to visionary researchers pushing the boundaries of knowledge, we embody a relentless pursuit of enlightenment, curiosity, and understanding.

We embrace change as an opportunity for growth and progress, constantly adapting to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Collaboration and attentive listening are at the heart of our journey, as we work hand in hand with our customers and each other to innovate and discover more effective ways to achieve our goals. We believe people thrive in an environment where Trust and Empowerment are at the forefront, which is why all our new team members are provided regularisation on their first day so they can start #PursuingPotential from day one.

Joining Cambridge means becoming a part of an extraordinary institution renowned worldwide. Beyond that, you'll become a part of a vibrant and forward-thinking community that transcends tradition, fostering a culture of continuous growth and personal development. Here, we provide the perfect environment for you to thrive, supporting your professional journey and empowering you to reach your highest potential.

What can you get from Cambridge?

In this role, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues from diverse branches, expanding your horizons and enriching your understanding of different cultures. We value your wellbeing and offer stability, fostering your professional and personal growth through internal and external activities and training sessions to help enrich your skillset.

Enjoy work-life balance flexibility through our range of options, including flexible schedules, hybrid work arrangements, and generous paid leave. As a regular employee on Day One, you'll have access to comprehensive healthcare benefits, ensuring your peace of mind with coverage for dependents, group life insurance, and robust well-being programs.

What will you do in this role?

As an Application Engineer, you will play a critical role in managing and planning the implementation of projects, works on day-to-day provision of technology support, and manage maintenance activities. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Manage and prepare for the implementation of projects in the operational/support environments including evaluation, feasibility, technical investigations, pilots, and proof of concepts, training and knowledge transfer to and from other support teams. Describe the key result areas (not the individual tasks) that this role is expected to deliver. Start with the most important. These can be unique to the organisation.

What makes you the ideal candidate in this role?
• Education & Experience: Degree or equivalent experience with at least 3 years in AWS Cloud Engineering, Architecture, or Infrastructure in a Systems Admin or DevOps role.
• System Administration & ITIL: Proficiency in Unix and Windows administration, ITIL best practices, incident management, service requests, and change management.
• DevOps & CI/CD: Experience with DevOps practices and CI/CD tools such as AWS CodePipeline, Jenkins, and Terraform.
• Cloud & Virtualization: Strong knowledge of AWS and Azure, troubleshooting cloud environments, and experience with virtualization technologies like VMware and Hyper-V.
• AWS Infrastructure: Familiarity with AWS services including EC2, ECS, Fargate, Route53, CloudWatch, API Gateway, Lambda, AWS databases, and networking.
• Application & Scripting: Experience in web hosting (IIS, Apache Tomcat), Java and .NET application support, and scripting in Shell, PowerShell, Bash, Java, or Python.
• Networking & Security: Understanding of networking concepts, firewalls, load balancers, and database technologies.
• Directory Services & Service Management: Knowledge of Active Directory, LDAP, DNS, DHCP, and service management processes.

Deadline of application submission is on April 12, 2025, but may close early if we receive sufficient applications. Therefore, if you are interested, please submit your application as early as possible. Whilst not essential, it is very advantageous if you submit a Cover Letter alongside your CV.

Please review the attached job description for further details on the role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is seeking a meticulous and knowledgeable Data Analyst to join their team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, where you will be responsible for analysing data, creating quality reports, and ensuring data accuracy across multiple sources.

What you'll do:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing complex data sets and creating quality reports. You will perform data reconciliation across various sources, ensuring the accuracy of all reports.
• Analyse data and create quality reports
• Perform data reconciliation across multiple sources to ensure accuracy
• Support initiatives for data integrity and normalisation
• Ingest and normalise customer data
• Communicate effectively with engineering and customer support teams
• Help enhance common interface standards through collaboration with multiple teams

What you bring:

The ideal candidate for the Data Analyst position brings at least two years of experience in SQL and Database along with a good understanding of SQL and Python/R. You possess strong abstraction logic skills which enable you to solve complex problems efficiently.
• At least 2 years of experience in SQL and Database
• Good understanding of SQL and Python/R
• Strong abstraction logic skills
• Willingness to learn new things
• Detail-oriented approach to tasks
• Ability to work both as part of a team and individually

What sets this company apart:

Our client is renowned for its commitment to innovation, fostering an environment that encourages continuous learning and growth. They value teamwork, integrity, and dedication, providing their employees with opportunities for professional development. Their inclusive culture promotes diversity, recognising the unique strengths that each individual brings.

What's next:

Ready for an exciting career move? Don't miss out on this opportunity!

Apply today by clicking on the link!

Due to the high volume of applications we are experiencing, our team will only be in touch with you if your application is shortlisted.

Title: Community Data Analyst II
Description:
Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments - creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them. You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.

Community Data Analyst II Job Description: Conduent Healthy Communities Institute

The Conduent Healthy Communities Institute (HCI) Data Team is looking for a Community Data Analyst II to gather, manage, and analyze health and health-related indicator data for community health platforms and consulting projects. This function supports the work of healthcare providers, health departments, and health collaboratives across the United States in their community health improvement efforts.

The Community Data Analyst II will perform the following:
• Manage and analyze large quantities of community health data
• Obtain data from online public sources through various formats (e.g., Excel, query tool, html tables, PDFs, etc.)
• Manipulate data and perform light statistics (usually in Excel) for upload into the HCI database
• Build and maintain indicator data for current and new HCI platform clients
• Perform quality control of data in spreadsheets, the HCI database, client platforms, and in other client deliverables such as reports and slide decks
• Understand and adhere to established procedures
• Assist with implementation of workflow and quality assurance improvements
• Collaborate with internal and external clients to answer data-related questions, ensuring the successful execution of products and services
• Support data-related tasks and projects brought forth by the Data Team, other Conduent HCI teams, and clients

Candidates will have the following skills and characteristics:
• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Information Technology, or related field (or comparable experience)
• At least 1 year of professional experience in data gathering, management or analysis
• Ability to navigate public data sources on the web
• Knowledgeable in basic statistics
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word
• Ability to learn new software such as a proprietary database tool
• Strong attention to detail
• Ability to work independently and collaborate with remote staff in the Philippines and the US

Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law.

Complete the form and then email it as an attachment to FTADAAA@conduent.com. You may also click here to access Conduent's ADAAA Accommodation Policy.

At Conduent we value the health and safety of our associates, their families and our community. For US applicants while we DO NOT require vaccination for most of our jobs, we DO require that you provide us with your vaccination status, where legally permissible. Providing this information is a requirement of your employment at Conduent.
